Reviews.Title: “Good Place actually.....”
Reviews.Author: Craigy11
Reviews.Content: Not far from the Termini ...about 10 mins walk and easy to find. Fantastic staff, very comfortable and clean rooms. Internet included in the price...brilliant. Breakfast is very good and if you don't want the machine coffee, the girls on duty will make you a proper one if you ask. Easy to get to all the places you want to see. I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Will return for sure”
Reviews.Author: rajeev s
Reviews.Content: Staff are fantastic, Mario and Muriel especially are fantastic from the time you check in and really very helpful. Even the cleaners and support staff go out of the way to help. Great location = everything is within walking distance, lively area and very safe. Breakfast was sufficient nothing to complain about, the only 2 slight minor irritations (1) was the unstable wi-fi connection (FREE) which kept dropping frequently when doing work on line (2) lack of plug/power points in the room. Rooms are very clean and to be honest we spent more time outside, so only needed a palce that was clean and had a good bed to sleep on. Will definitely return to Rome and stay at the Hotel Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Rome 2012”
Reviews.Author: Fiona L Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: 2nd time here. Hotel location is great. 10 min walk to Trevino fountain and colosseum. Everthing in easy walking distance. Metro at the top of the road. Friendly helpful reception staff. They arranged airport pick up before trip and gave us a helpful map with tips on arrival. Main road on one side, I've only been in a room at the back, which was ok noise wise. But not sure of the front. Continental breakfast was nice.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near the Colosseum and Piazza Venezia, very good is also the proximity to the Termini railway station and the subway stations. The city's old town is easily reached on foot. The hotel service is very good and friendly, good breakfast buffet

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and the room very clean.”
Reviews.Author: Mmifsudtaylor
Reviews.Content: Staff are very friendly and helpful, breakfast is sufficient and rather good. The rooms are slightly small but they are clean and very cosy. I recommend this hotel and will definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “tidy hotel, central location for sightseeing.”
Reviews.Author: bythor
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine, with tidy rooms and helpful staff. It's on a main road, but we weren't troubled at all by normal traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Long night”
Reviews.Author: Karen P
Reviews.Content: This hotel room was something out of a nightmare. The room was unbelievably hot. The person showing me to the room turned on the A/C for me, and an hour later the room was no cooler. I tried leaving the floor but at night they close the fire door to the stairway and elevator making it nearly impossible to find. Walking around and around I felt like I was going to start seeing "redrum redrum!" painted on the walls. It was really creepy! Turns out the door was inside another area that they open during the day. Not able to find the exit, I settled back in my room. Having had enough for the day I turned out the lights and tried to sleep. Somewhere in the middle of the night, with the air conditioner making a lot of noise but not reducing the temperature in the room, I turned on the light to go use the restroom. Suddenly everything in the room went silent and dark. I call down to the front desk to find out a fuse had blown in the room. Stumbling through the dark I find the fuse box conveniently located behind the door and the front desk walked me through fixing the problem. Woke-up the next morning to find bags of dirty linens stacked two and three deep down the hallway in front of the room. Also, when I checked in the night before they said they would have a room available for the next night, as I was leaving to go out for the day they inform me they did not have a room for the night. I was almost relieved to hear the news. Went down the street to a hostel, spent half the money, had a kitchen, and a very clean room twice the size The only plus to this hotel was the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: 1vacanza1
Reviews.Content: Second time staying at the Miami. Clean comfortable rooms and plenty to choose from continental breakfast. Only problem was our bedroom must have been under the breakfast room, everytime that some moved their table or chair they scraped it accross the floor which we could hear and was really annoying. Lots of nice restaurants nearby as well as plenty clothes shops. Whe did take a city bus tour, however we ended up walking round most of the attractions which are not that far from the hotel. Excellent location and will return again on next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to attractions”
Reviews.Author: SAArnie
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel and the staff are very friendly, helpful and caring. The location is excellent to most of the attractions. Breakfast was a nice start to the day. Very busy road the hotel is situated on but didn't hear traffic. Shops and restaurants on the road are welcoming. My husband was due to come on this holiday but due to an illness the day before was unable to fly. I will along with my husband next time be returning to Rome hopefully next year and will definitely be staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place with a good location and reasonable pricing”
Reviews.Author: Natalia_K
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the location, reasonable price, typical breakfast. Awful coffee in the mornings though. Also quite a strange impression was left by reception due to the following incident: we have done some shopping (mens shirts and a suit) and were so tierd by the end of the day, that when we have reached the room itself, left the bag with goods next to our room door- just stupidly entered without noticing it's still standing outside. In 15 minutes we realized it's not with us and checked - nothing outside. Went downstairs to reception to ask, and they said: nope, we've seen nothing. Then we were still standing, and i asked again- you sure nobody seen the bag on 3rd floor next to romm xxx? And then suddenly the answer was:" ahh, there...next to room xxx... Yes, here is it!" I mean, it was our stupidity, but the hotel manager actually tried hard to convince us it wasn't with them.... Weird! And made me dislike the rest of the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: bgorboi
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel in a rush for a weekend break in November. Rome is wonderful, and all we needed is a base for the countless kms we walked around the city, so location was key. Via Nazionale is good spot to start and just in few mins you can arrive to P.za Venezia, or thru the tunnel P.za Spagna. The hotel had well furnished, clean, comfortable, yet small rooms, with small bathrooms. The breakfast was better than the usual very basic Italian breakfasts, still don't expect too much if you're used to real continental ones. I don't think this was the best hotel I've ever been, but we really didn't need it. It was good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: balleen
Reviews.Content: Hotel Miami is located on Via Nazionale an excellent location for sightseeing. All of the major tourist attractions are within walking distance. The vatican was the only place that we got a bus too. Termini is about a ten minute walk. It is possible to walk to the hotel from Termini but it is hard work with suitcases rolling along the cobbled streets. The hotel reception staff are so helpful they really go out of their way to help you. The rooms are small but so so clean and the room is kept really clean throughout your stay. I would really have to say that we were hugely impressed by the cleaning standards in this hotel. We had asked for a room in a quiet part of the hotel which we were given and had no problems at all getting to sleep. The breakfast is buffet style that was kept well stocked - breakfast room is a little small. The lift is also a little on the small side when travelling with a lot of luggage. Overall an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: anmcc
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Miami, Rome for one week in July this year. Our party consisted of 2 families so we had booked 4 rooms (2 double and 2 twin). The hotel shares the building with other businesses but this is not a problem. Rooms were kept spotlessly clean. The hotel reception staff were extremely helpful at all times. We also took our breakfast - the breakfast room is quite small so we tended to go quite early but there was plenty of choice at all times. Hotel is located on Via Nazionale which is a main thoroughfare filled with many shops - at one end is the Termini where you can board the Tour Buses and at the other end is the wonderful Piazza Venezia - from here it is a short walk to the Colosseum. It is about a 10 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain so it was very convenient for all major attractions. The only time we didn't walk was when going to the Vatican. For anyone who likes markets there is one every Sunday - the largest market I have ever seen. This is our second visit to this hotel and would not hesitate in going again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Alison B
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Miami is placed well, within walking distance of the main sites of interest. And close to busesnetc for other trips. The hotel has excellent staff who are very helpful and friendly. Our luggage was late to arrive and they handled it for us. They gave excellent advice on places to eat and handy tips on when to visit various places. The rooms are just what are needed for a short site seeing visit to Rome. Very clean and comfortable. The breakfast was a good start to the day

Reviews.Title: “Not impressive to look at but very good on a limited budget”
Reviews.Author: KevinTorontoCanada29
Reviews.Content: It is a SHARED BUILDING: hotel and business combined together. It is typical older European. The highlight was the tall ceilings in the room, bed was comfortable, the Juliet balcony overlooking the main street. Breakfast was simple but good. Low point: bathroom was dated with no tub. We would book there again

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: DCAtravler
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed one night upon arriving in Italy and one night before we left. In both cases the llocation was the main reason, but the second night it was no longer an unknown quanity. We made the booking after we had spent one night there. The breakfast was certainly enough to get you started for the day, although I admit it wasn't really a deal breaker for us . As I remember there was cereal, pastries,meat(ham,I think) cheese. Juice. coffee, & tea. By far the hotel's finest asset is their staff, in particular reception. They were helpful with directions, taxis,and many questions. One young lady helped us with our bags to our room. Be aware there are small steps(up or down) which are unexpected and might put you off balance. Just something to watch for, and they add to the charm of the old building.

Reviews.Title: “lovely staff, lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kat201119
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here in August, my BF booked it as a surprise birthday gift for me so i was a little sceptical as to what he had booked but it was perfect, it looks so typically Italian i loved it immidiately. its on one of the main road in Rome so you dont have to walk far to get anywhere the trevi fountain is about a 10 minute walk, and the colluseum around a 15 minute walk. it has a lovely view, the staff were fab and couldn't do enough for us. the only negative i have is the breakfast it really wasnt my cup of tea but my BF liked it so i suppose its just a matter of tastes. all in all this hotel is perfect for a sightseeing holday to the most beautiful city in the world.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel but not good breakfast !!”
Reviews.Author: vimmyarora
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at this hotel ..Nice hotel at a good location .We got the room on 5th floor ..Peaceful and quiet room. Termini station just 10 minutes away and Repubblica metro station just 5 minutes away ..Despar Hypermarket just 1 minute away ...Mc donald's and Burger King Nearby. Staff is friendly . Although we didnt like breakfast offered in this hotel as there were no plain bread , no fresh fruits and no eggs ...The breads they offered were so hard ...so I have to buy my own bread loafs for two days ..

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel,great location”
Reviews.Author: David W
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very inexpensive, very clean and quite spacious. Desk staff were very helpful and provided lots of information. Location was ideal on Via Nazionale within walking distance of all attractions for the tourist. Would definitely stay agian

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: chacha7602
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here upon arriving in Rome in late June. The property is located in the middle of an office building which was a new experience for us, but the location was great for all Rome's attractions. Our concierge, Mario, greeted us warmly and was very helpful throughout our stay. He recommended a wonderful restaurant, al Boschetto, which has a lovely courtyard in the back. He gave us directions for almost everything we needed to do! The breakfasts in the morning were fine, with the exception of the coffee which came out of a machine. That said, the breakfast was still nice with a nice variety of food and the breakfast room was very clean and pleasant. All of the other hotels where we stayed in Italy had coffee served to our table. The rooms were a nice size with lovely bathrooms and everything was very clean!!! The beds were comfortable and the air conditioning was SUPERB!!!!! I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Kookie57
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to spend 4 nights at Hotel Miami, which is only a 15 minute walk to the Tremini Train Station. This hotel was recommended through a friend of a friend and I booked it on trust and was pleasantly surprised! The hotel is in an excellent location, along a fantastic shopping district, with a number of restaurants all around the building. Our room was clean and immaculate with a great view of the Via Nazionale. Breakfast provided an excellent variety of options, everything was fresh and delicious, especially the coffees! Reception staff Mario and Francesco were extremely hospitable, friendly and helpful. We will definitely stay at Hotel Miami for all future trips back to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Well located and good value”
Reviews.Author: Beluga58
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located close to a subway station and within walking distance from the train terminal. Air-conditioned rooms are well kept and comfortable. Continental breakfast is standard.

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem!”
Reviews.Author: ladytraveller65
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real find! With its central location it is an ideal base for visiting all the main tourist attractions. Staff were friendly and helpfull particularly Francesco on Reception who made us feel instantly welcome when we arrived and gave us vast amounts of useful info.Our bedroom and bathroom were spotless as was the Breakfast room.The Continental Breakfast was excellent with a good choice available. I would always head for this Hotel when visiting Rome

Reviews.Title: “Bed bug bitten in rather worn hotel”
Reviews.Author: IandM
Reviews.Content: Apart from the bed bug/louse incident (which will be described below), we were satisfied with this hotel. It is a rather worn, 2-3 star property (depending on what you compare it to), but all in all rather OK by Italian standards, and especially for Rome. The rest: Location is good, depending on what you want to be close to, lots of shopping venues and cafés along Via Nazionale. Rooms are nice, a bit shabby, but reasonably clean and spacious, and except for a rather nasty bed spread (again, normal by Italian standards) and some chipped and worn furniture, no complaints. Breakfast much better than average in Italy/Southern Europe, lots to choose from and even fresh fruit daily (although orange cordial instead of juice, but again, that is pretty normal in the area). Housekeeping was thorough. Some members of reception staff very nice, some very rude. So all in all, good value for money if you get a good rate and just want an OK room in a good location to lay your head whilst in Rome. If you're after comfort and pampering and super clean modern facilities then give it a miss (but expect to pay a lot more). Our experience: My husband was bitten by a bed bug/wall louse in the middle of the night, which caused some pain and a considerable swelling of his shoulder area. He caught and killed the bug, and went down to reception to report incident and ask for another room. Reception staff was sympathetic, but offered no more than clean sheets, and we had to change the linens ourselves in the middle of the night - NOT ideal. The lady in the reception the next morning was very rude but eventually we got a new room, and thorough cleaning by housekeeping. The manager assured that it was a one off, and also compensated for one night's stay and offered a dinner at a nearby restaurant, so all in all, the situation was handled well, eventually. If it hadn't been for the bite, we'd probably stay here again (and would probably have rated it a little higher), but as it is ... well ... probably not, but we wouldn't discourage others either, just be aware that if this happens to you, it was not a one off. If nobody else has the same experience (and we sincerely hope not!!), however, by all means stay here and enjoy. (Rating below is a little off, since it is a sort of mean between overall experience apart from the bed bug incident and the incident itself. Some staff members behaved admirably and some were rude, sleep quality was very good on all the preceding nights, but obviously horrendous on the night in question and not very good after, cleanliness by and large was good and well above average, but then again, the bug had to come from somewhere ... but we've tried to be as fair as we can, considering.)

Reviews.Title: “So disappointed by the way we were treated.”
Reviews.Author: sandylarge
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fabulous location. It is an old hotel but meets all standards. Had a wonderful stay that was ruined by 2 incidents. Purchased 24 hours of wifi & was told had the entire week to use it. When it stopped working after 3 days same person said "Oh no you had to use it in 3 days". I would never have purchased 24 hrs if I knew I had to use it in 3 days. Then we found out we had to leave a day early & gave 2 days notice. We were told their policy is 3 days. They held us to it & charged us for a night we weren't there. This was after I had booked two groups of family members to stay at this hotel before & after my stay! I wrote to the manager about this & he did not even have the courtesy to respond. Do yourself a favor & boycott this joint.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Loved_Rome_11
Reviews.Content: Nice 3 star hotel, very good value for money if your after a place to simply rest at the end of a busy day sightseeing - then this is perfect. Walking distance to all the sights - only time we used the metro was to visit the Vatican. Room (triple) was lovely and clean - beds made and room tidied daily and fresh towels everyday. Breakfast was basic but you could eat as much as you wanted. Staff very helpful and speak very good English. I would definitely return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: babis_d
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok, nothing special about it. The location is convenient, close to some sights and the Repubblica metro station. The breakfast did not have much variety. From what I understood the hotel mostly deals with travel agencies so do not be surprised if you check in after 13:00 because all rooms are booked. It happened to me, I arrived at 9:00 and had to wait till 13:30 to go to my room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico!”
Reviews.Author: hev217
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Miami at the beginning of Feb 2011. The hotel suited our needs completely and was within walking distance of all the main attractions. The staff were pleasant and the room was excellent value for money. The breakfast had a good range of continental items and even at peak time we were able to get a table. We would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a bargain quality 3* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, not very comfortable bed and small shower!”
Reviews.Author: Kfizzo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in December. The hotel is in a great location, easy walk to Pantheon, Trevi Fountain and Colloseum. You can get the metro to Vatican City, but we walked and it did not feel very long. The rooms are standard, the shower is very very very small. The bed was very hard and not that comfortable to sleep on. The room was clean though and was made up every day. There is not much to choose from with the breakfatst, but you did not leave feeling hungry either. The staff were friendly and their service was good. I do not think I would stay here again though.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Miami, Via Nazionale, Rome, Italy”
Reviews.Author: amt14
Reviews.Content: Value for money middle of the range Hotel which is centrally located for all site seeing

Reviews.Title: “Look no further for a excellent 3 star hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: JimOCDublin
Reviews.Content: All the staff at the Miami Hotel were very friendly and helpful. our room was absolutely spotless, The breakfast was excellant and the location brilliant. A handy walk to the trevi Fountaine, The Spanish Steps and the Colosseum. The 64 bus passes the door and will take you to the Vatican for €1. What more could you ask for? My Wife and I strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding in Rome, fantastic stay at hotel Miami :0)”
Reviews.Author: MicaLucyPolly
Reviews.Content: Date of stay 22/09/2010 to 29/09/2010 Small wedding party consisting of family members staying at the hotel Miami. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and the reception staff were exceptional and went out of their way to accomadate us. We would like to say a special thank you to all staff at hotel Miami and especially Mario who helped us on a number of occasions. We would highly recommend this hotel, its in a great location and easy walk to most attractions with a metro line a short walk away and staff speaking excellent English and so helpful. The breakfast room may be a bit small but the breakfast is superb for a buffet. One tip, the coffee behind the counter is much nicer than from the self service machine. We give this hotel 10 out of 10 for friendliness, location, rooms and value for money. Hope to book this hotel for our anniversary this time next year. Thank you all again for making our stay so pleasant. Fantastico!! Mr & Mrs Gregory

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, very helpful, quiet, location good”
Reviews.Author: Weerder
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Hotel Miami for five nights at the beginning of September. It had been recommended but we were concerned after reading the mixed reviews on this site. We arrived earlier than check in but our rooms were clean and they let us check in. We had requested a quiet room and we got it. The bedroom and bathroom were big enough though the shower might be a bit tight for larger bodies. Excellent, inexpensive WiFi service for my laptop. Breakfast - good, standard continental breakfast though tea and coffee were poor, coming from a machine. The area is safe but not very interesting. Go to a different area to eat or people watch. The staff were very friendly and helpful and we were given good advice about how to get where, including taking the metro to the Vatican (a major visit for us) rather than walking in the heat. All other sights are easy walking distance. The Metro is very close and easy to use, as is Termini though suitcases over the cobbled streets makes the walk longer than normal. Termini to the airport is an easy journey - and much to be recommended over the "scary ride of death" we had in a mini bus when we arrived! As in most continental European coutnries, if you don't like the room you are first shown - ask for another. It is common practice to offer the least attractive first.

Reviews.Title: “Life saver”
Reviews.Author: sheepish16
Reviews.Content: When the volcanic ash cloud hit we were in transit in Rome and were shuttled late in the evening to the Miami Hotel. It was a god send as we had started the day in the Greek Islands and were on our way flying to Nice. The staff were fabulously helpful and allowed us to keep our room on standby each day until we could get a train ticket to Ventimiglia 3 days later. We were well rested, the breakfast was lovely and the rooms were clean and comfortable. The location was excellent and allowed us to really enjoy our unexpected 3 days in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “amazing city, amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jono27
Reviews.Content: This is just a short e-mail to say thank you to the staff at Hotel Miami Rome. I stayed at this Hotel from 06/08/2010 to 09/08/2010. You made our stay in Rome an enjoyable and memorable one. I will definitely be recommending Hotel Miami to family and friends for future reference. The whole stay from the time we booked in to the time we booked out was professional and exceeded all expectations. Anyone looking for a great affordable hotel with professional service in a great location to enjoy the amazing city of Rome, then book at Hotel Miami, you won't be sorry. Thank you once again for your hospitality and for adding to make our time in Rome so amazing. Hope to stay at your hotel in the near future. Thanks again. Jono

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: Irish1978
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not on the scale of a Hilton, a Mariott or similar nor are the facilities but we found if prefect for exploring Rome as it is central and close to the main railway and bus station. Like most of the city centre hotels in Rome the hotel is in a old building, in this instance it is a shared building which means the layout is very strange. Hotel reception staff are friendly and approachable and happy to advise you where things are in the city and how best to get to them, there is also a supply of free maps in the reception. We had a late flight and they had no issue keeping our baggage on site until almost 4pm. Room itself was old fashioned in decor (but most hotels in Rome seem to be the same), it was clean with plenty of storage space and the bed was comfy - the air conditioning was also very powerful. Bathrooms were functional and pressure in the shower was great. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “family wedding in Rome”
Reviews.Author: kathleendevlin50
Reviews.Content: We were a prty of 7 adults, (3 women & 4 young gentlemen) Hotel was well situated for sight seeing, shopping & strolling safely at night. The security was very good at night time. The hotel staff at reception were very friendly, helpful & had good English which was very important as none of our party could speak Italian. Reception was never unattended & staff very willingly gave us a history lesson of Rome. The breakfast was continential as expected & plentiful. The bedrooms were very clean, bed linen very well laundered, rooms adequate size & air-conditioned. I would have no hesitation in returning to stay again in Hotel Miami.

Reviews.Title: “good for a hostel...but by far not a hotel”
Reviews.Author: GlobetrotterRo
Reviews.Content: There are actually two halfs of floors, the other halfs being occupied by companies or something else. The room I had is the smallest room I have ever stayed....and about the bathroom, what can I say.. UNUSABLE...(please see the photos). Breakfast is below average, but typically for Italy. Although they say you have wi-fi in the room and you can pay in order to access the internet it not exactly like that. In the room I was hosted there were no wi-fi networks. Impossible to use the TV which was so high located and just above the bed. Overall, very poor quality, i will never chose this hoStel again. There are much better hotels in the same area within the same price range. But as a personal opinion, in Italy in general the hotels are very poor in quality and comfort. Probably the owners are relying only on new tourists and they are not interested on having same clients!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Rome if on a budget”
Reviews.Author: EUTraveller22
Reviews.Content: My partner and I and her father stayed in Hotel Miami in June 2010 for 4 nights. The location of this hotel is perfect for sightseeing around Rome. We did do quite a bit of walking, but were able to walk to all the major tourist attractions such as Pantheon, Spanish Steps, Colluseum, Forum etc. with minimal fuss. Location was absolutely the draw card with this hotel, and it certainly didn't disappoint. That said, the rooms were very clean and tidy, and the breakfast was good. We got a triple share room including breakfast. It was, as per usual with Europe, quite cramped, but was big enough (just). It would be perfectly fine for a couple, and I would even suggest that anything more than this hotel would just be a waste of money. One drawback that I could potentially see is the room we were in was located directly next to the breakfast room, which would have been very bad if we had wanted to sleep in - fortunately we were up early each day, so it didn't impact us, but that room particularly could have been a little noisy otherwise. We spent about 8 weeks on the road and stayed in about 25 different hotels along the way, and prior to the trip this was one of the ones I was most concerned about based on the reviews on this site. If you are considering this hotel, I believe you should book it - it's the perfect location, was well priced based on everything around it, and was clean and neat with a nice breakfast. We will likely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CRR63
Reviews.Content: This hotel whilst a little odd as it seems to be housed in an office block the hotel meet every requirement. It was very friendly, good breakfast but the only thing i can say i would have liked to see was tea and coffee making in the room as there is no where in the hotel to get this in the day this is available in the restaurants We managed to walk to all the sites even the vatican was an hours walk through lovely streets and shops

Reviews.Title: “Slightly Odd - but an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mpad
Reviews.Content: Hotel Miami is odd only in that it occupies parts of a large building - so the reception is a small room on the ground floor whilst the rooms are on floors 3 and 4 (and a few on floor 5). The reception is excellent and, as others have commented, really helpful in all respects - especially for first time Rome visitors. The rooms are along rather dark corridors and are bigish but slightly uninspiring. If you are at the front don't even think of opening the windows - the street noise is unbelievable (you will also get bitten by mosquitos)!! So, once we had worked out how the aircon worked, we were fine - windows shut but nice and cool (explanation of aircon in the book on the dressing table, just took me a day to find it)! The location of the Hotel is SUPERB - just use the Metro or the No 64 bus - a day ticket for both is about 8 euros. The breakfast room on the 5th floor is a bit pokey (well very pokey) and the staff a bit offhand but the breakfasts were really good (plenty over for a bit of a packed lunch)!!! Whilst not the world's most pretty hotel it must be about as good as you can get as a base for a visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Vickifm
Reviews.Content: Hotel Miami was pretty impressive. It's at 5 to 10 minutes of walk to from the Termini (central station of Rome) and a 2 minutes walk from the station of metro Repubblica... So it's really well located; colosseum is at 15 minutes of walk... The staff was really nice, they helped us to find the attractions on the map. The breakfeasts were really good too. The only negative thing is that walls are really thin so you hear whatever your neighbor is doing. But for the price we paid, it was absolutely perfect, I would recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: SereBe
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Miami Hotel several times. It's right in the heart of Rome so you can easily walk around the city. The rooms are nice and always clean, the staff is friendly and willing to help. The breakfast room is somehow small however cosy. If you choose a room with a view on the street you won't regret it! I definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, walking distance for attractions, excellent staff, Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: idelwanderer
Reviews.Content: Many thanks to Mario who was very helpful during our stay. Hotel is very convenient for major attractions, Roma tour bus stop 5 minutes away. Plenty of restaurants on Via Nazionale. Rooms were very clean and comfortable, some street noise but not too bad. Would book again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location and very helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: travelbug99ireland
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is situated in Via Nazionale about 10 minutes walk from Termini station. It is actually situated on 5th floor of an office block but you can find reception on the ground floor. We arrived on Wed 14th April and when we checked in we were given a map of Rome and told all the best places to visit. Staff very extremely helpful and gave us all the information we needed. We were shown to our room on the 5th floor and our luggage was brought up to us. Was pleasantly surprised at the size of the bedroom. Large double bed and ample space. The bathroom was a little on the small size and shower was situated inside a narrow bed - may be a problem for some people but only a minor issue to us. Breakfast each morning was very good.... consisted of a continental buffet but included a lot more than a lot of hotels I've stayed in. Range of juices, croissants, rolls, ham, cheese, biscuits, fruit, etc. While we were in Rome the volcano in Iceland erupted for the first time and our flight was cancelled. We decided to make our way to Cherbourg in France and get the ferry back to Ireland. I couldn't thank our hotel enough for their help in trying to arrange transport for us. They contacted several hire car companies for us but it some became apparent that we wouldn't be able to take a hire car out of Italy - many people had the same idea. They checked train and bus websites and priced a number of taxi and minbus firms. They went beyond what most hotels would do for guests and from talking to other people from other hotels we were most definitely well looked after. Would highly receommend this hotel to anyone. I do a lot of research into hotels when booking any trip and always rely on Tripadvisor posts. This hotel is in a great location.... walking distance to all the major attractions - Colosseum, Roman Forum, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Patheon, etc. Vatican is a little further but it's in at the other side of the river from all the other sites. We took the No 64 bus (think that's the number - hotel will tell you and you can buy tickets in the shop around the corner). Accommodation in Rome can be quite expensive and Hotel Miami was the cheapest I could find for the location and it was worth it. If I ever go back to Rome I wouldn't hesitate to stay in Hotel Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Good little Hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AviatorHouston_UK
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is situated in Via Nazionale about 10 minutes walk from Termini station. I had booked the room via an airline website and was only offered a standard room. I e-mailed the Hotel asking if we could upgrade on arrival and they replied 10 minutes later to say that they would give us a good room for no upgrade cost. Room was quite large (by Rome standards) with a small minibar. It also had the smallest bathroom I have ever seen - although did not spend too much time there! The room was surprisingly quiet, therefore, able to get a good sleep at night. Staff are very friendly and breakfast, although simple, was good quality. Spar supermarket about 30m away. If you leave the Hotel, turn left, left again, there is a Cafe/Trattoria that is incredibly good value for lunch or drinks.

Reviews.Title: “A good value hotel close to metro and historic sites”
Reviews.Author: felicityjg
Reviews.Content: We had booked to go to Rome some time prior to December and were about to be stuck due to the proposed BA strike. On contacting the hotel the Receptionist was most accommodating and readily agreed to lessen the cancellation period from 72 hours to 24 so we could learn what was happening regarding the strike. We were all accommodated on the 5th floor and although our room was at the front of the hotel there was little noise to bother us. The rooms were obviously fairly recently refurbished and clean and tidy, although the marble floors were a little cold in December, the room was well heated. The breakfast was more than adequate and better than some Italian hotels. The bread rolls, croissant and pain au chocolat were all fresh and the coffee, from a machine was good. The hotel's location was excellent and within easy walking distance of many restaurants and also the historic area.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel in the center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: KateP80
Reviews.Content: I chosed this hotel because of its location. It's about 5 minutes by foot from Termini station, 10 minutes by foot from Piazza di Venezia, 15 minutes by foot from Piazza di Spagna. It's situated on via Nazionale where you can find a lot of shops, restaurants. The hotel itself is a small family hotel, it's situated on one floor in office building. Our room wasn't very big, but the bathroom was big enough. Everything was clean. The only problem was that the air conditioner worked only when you were inside the room, so when we turned to the room after the whole day in Rome, it was a little bit stuffy in the room. But air conditioner worked good and in half an hour the temperature in the room was OK. The view from our room was to small yard, so no view at all. But the most time we spent walking so when we came back to hotel the view from window didn't interest us. The price was good, quite budget and included breakfast. The staff was very friedly and helpful. Overall I liked this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the cost”
Reviews.Author: docLongmont
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Rome this Nov. Hotel Miami is an excellent value. Hotel is in very good location---close to most highlights in Rome, also close to metro and buslines. The hotel is very clean, breakfasts are good, and the staff are very helpful. We enjoyed our stay. Ask for a room in the back of hotel as the hotel is on a very busy street.

Reviews.Title: “Decent.”
Reviews.Author: NRMDEM
Reviews.Content: It's in an office building and getting to our room was a bit of a maze--the set up is a bit odd. But once we were inside our room was pretty big, although the bathroom shower was tiny. Very clean overall. Find out about the breakfast at check in, we missed it. Overall the service was good, including for restaurant reservations. The location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Firefly1977
Reviews.Content: Hotel Miami is in Via Nazionale, one of the best locations (in my view) to say in Rome - close to Repubblica Metro Stop which is, in turn, just one short stop away from the main Rome train station. Besides, it is a very comfortable walk away from the main sites. So, I would definitely go for this hotel for its location. It is also a very good hotel in its own right. First of all, the rooms are well-appointed and spotlessly clean. Our room perhaps was a tad small but for what we paid, it was an excellent room with an alcove housing two huge wardrobes, which meant that, had we undone our suitcases (as normal people do) and used the wardrobes, and removed our enormous suitcases from the walkway, then we would have had ample room. Therefore, the dimensions of the room reflects more our untidiness rather than the room's dimensions! Housekeeping service was fantastic and the room would be tidied up in an incredible manner (we used to leave shopping bags around) and the staff at reception was excellent. Breakfast was fine and was above average when compared to hotels in the same category (3-star). Our room overlooked Via Nazionale but the windows are so well insulated that none of the traffic din which busy streets in Rome are renowned for reached us and we used to sleep extremely well. I booked this room through booking.com and I also used their best rate guarantee since it was more expensive on their site than on the hotel's site. When contacting booking.com, I was issued with another booking voucher with the revised price. This was absolutely great because both booking.com and the hotel showed how serious they are about their business. In a few words: if you find availability at this hotel: just book. It's a great hotel with attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Rome”
Reviews.Author: llm2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Oct 1-6, 2009: Wonderful front desk staff, good breakfast, busy place! Very well situated: just a couple of short blocks to Piazza Republica metro stop; and a few more blocks to Roma Termini train station (didn't know it so we paid 10EUR for taxi). Room was very clean, but average decor. No amenties (pool, gym, room service) but we knew this going in...not things we wanted/needed anyway. However, we were pleasantly surprised by the champagne in our room upon our return the 1st night. A very nice home base for sightseeing. A word of warning to light sleepers: our room faced Via Nazionale (4th floor) and it was extremely noisy all night as it's a very busy thoroughfare. We didn't mind but if noise is an issue I don't think you'll like it. To me, the sound of the Italian accordion music wafting thru the night air from the street vendor's cart below was lovely...and it did help to drown out the traffic noise. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very good room, very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Seen_Lots_Of_World
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights. The Room was excellent as was the bathroom. Breakfast was also 8 out of 10. TV was all Italian. We could walk the 1kilometer Hotel from the Main Railway Termini and save the 20 Euro Fare the taxi driver asked for. We walked to all main archeological sites easily with an 8 year old. There were good cafe, pubs and restaurents in easy reach. Note Children are free on the Airport Express Train. They are free on the tube and bus up to age 12. Take you drivers licence or E111 to the museums to get reduced adult prices for being an EU Citizen and children again are free. Also look at a Roma Pass to save on Museums and travel. We did not use one.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: FrannieHaifa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights during a family vacation in Rome. The location is fabulous, the hotel being within a short walking distance from the main touristic attractions: the Fontana di Trevi, the Spanish Steps, The Venezia Square, the awesome Colloseum. The rooms, although relatively small, are spotless clean, the beds quite comfortable. The best part of the hotel is its staff. Mario, Adriano and Francesco were incredibly kind and helpful to us and went out of their way to supply the information we asked for in order to better explore the city. I gladly recommend this hotel to anyone who plans to travel to Rome and is looking for a charming place to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “My short break in rome”
Reviews.Author: karenWestYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a 3 night break in Rome, we stayed in the Miami hotel in the city centre, the hotel was excellent everything was very good. The staff were very helpfull and the room was spotless, we had clean towels every day whilst we were there. We were near to all the city sights and we found wonderfull resteraunts to eat every night, i would reccomend the hotel Miami in Rome to anyone who is thinking of going on a short break. We travelled with Jet 2 airlines and we couldnt fault them they were excellent, overall an excellent short break in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “great location - good value”
Reviews.Author: linfield2004
Reviews.Content: Hotel Miami is in the perfect location for a trip to central Rome, the Hotel is situated on Via Nazionale a premiere shopping street, bustling with tourists & roman workers alike. The hotels reception is located on the ground floor of a 6 story office building, the actual rooms are on the 5th & 6th floors and accessed by a 4 person lift, a little tight with luggage! The rooms are compact but spotless! they overlook the main street but the traffic noise is minimal, & the air conditioning is great - 82 degrees at the end of September. The bathroom was again spotless, the only issue we had was it could be a little tricky using the shower due to the 3/4 size bathtub it was housed in, but this was a minor issue. Breakfast was taken on the 5th floor, it could get crowded at times but tables always became free pretty quickly, breakfast included cereals, juice, cheeses, ham, yoghurts pastries & croissants, coffee & teas, all in all perfectly adequate to start the day. Mario on reception was superb, totally efficient & very helpful with our requests, rearranged our transportation at short notice did it all with a smile, thank you Mario. All the major attractions are within walking distance from the hotel, the area is very safe most romans are polite & courteous to lost tourists invading their space. Rome can be a very expensive city to visit given the current sterling v euro value, but the hotel Miami was good value for money in our opinion

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: TO_traveller41
Reviews.Content: We only had a few days in Rome and this hotel was very well situated in the city close to most of the sites in the city. Only a 10 minute walk from the train station as well. Hotel was clean and the breakfast was the standard European fare, with one exception that they have a full espresso maker in the room that is not used. If you want coffee you need to use one of those automated machines. Just not the same. Staff were helpful and we got a room early when we arrived. Room was clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location--nice budget accommodations”
Reviews.Author: 1i_of_Arabia
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days in June. The front desk service was great. The desk clerks all spoke excellent English, which spared everyone my severely broken Italian. The rooms were clean & well maintained. They are a little small by American standards, but average European size based on my expericence. They met our needs just fine. The hotel is centrally located on Via Nazionale less than 1 km from a metro stop. It is within easy walking distance to Trevi Fountain, the Pantheon, the Colosseum & the Spanish Steps. We found the continental breakfast quite adequate & enjoyed it very much. Meats, cheese, rolls, pastries & cereal were on the bar as well as cappucino, espresso & juice. Everything was nice & fresh. Others have mentioned that the hotel shares the building with other businesses. The hotel appears to have a floor or two in the building; the other floors looked like professional offices (doctors & banking offices). They were no distraction at all & I never heard any noise from them. We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Miami & would recommend it to a friend for a short stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NMTM
Reviews.Content: We had a good experience at the Hotel Miami. The front desk was helpful, spoke english and gave us good tips when we asked. The accomodations are clean and safe. If you just want a hotel for somewhere clean and safe to sleep at a budget price its perfect. The breakfast was the pretty typical Italian fare and was included in the price. Its close to a few different metro stations, but I noticed that the Rome metro system isn't really overly helpful if you're headed to certain areas of town. If I was in Rome again I would probably look to stay closer to Piazza Navona (it was my favorite area for the evening) but if you want to be in the center of town this is a decent home base area. Overall, the Hotel Miami was what we were looking for and fulfilled our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: JudiBatten
Reviews.Content: I have been meaning to write this review since our return in March. We stayed at the Hotel Miami for three nights in March and had a fantastic time. The rooms are not the biggest I've stayed in but they are very clean and perfectly adequate. Breakfast is great, a wide variety, something for everyone. I found the staff extremely helpful and friendly. Although a slightly odd location (the hotel is situated over other premises) the area could not be better, no need for public transport at all, we could walk everywhere, even the vatican city is within an easy walk. Walking is by far the best way to get around you will miss too much otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “simple hotel,easy to walk to from train and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: sunflower27ireland
Reviews.Content: Hotel Miami is about 10 min.walk from the termini train station in rome. It's not easy to find. But once there, we were very pleased. Mario at the reception is very helpful, the rooms were very compact and suited us perfectly. The toilet did not flush- but was fixed within an hour of mentioning to Mario. The hotel is ideally located in the center. The staff even stored our luggage for the afternoon after we checked-out. So we enjoyed our few last hours in rome without worrying about the carrying of bags. Don't expect a nutritional breakfast....We would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: philisfog
Reviews.Content: Great value,good hotel,great location(main throughafare of city)most attractions only 10 to 15 mins away by foot with an enjoyable walk to each.nice room and not as small as expected.friendly and informative staff. Breakfast was decent by european standards.Only disapointment was the Taxi journey from train station which was only around the corner and walkable that cost € 27 euro. Be careful with taxis and especially and any unscruplous locals that can be known to take advantage around any tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Location great, room just OK”
Reviews.Author: barbara5london
Reviews.Content: Like all the reviews have said, this hotel is a great location if you're arriving/leaving Rome by train - including train from the airport. The room was OK for me and my friend although the twin room we had was tiny. Air con worked a charm and we didn't suffer at all from the noisy main street with the window shut/air con on. Pillows are like rocks, bed is hard - but we were in Rome to see the sites, not sit in the room. I wouldn't stay there again if travelling with my husband as we are more used to a bit more comfort. The shower drain backed up (yick) and although we're slim, it was a squeeze getting in / out. The breakfast room was packed/chairs back to back - cheap coffee machine rather than yummy Italian espresso - would recommend going round the corner for a coffee! For all the negatives, it's a decent place for a few nights - wonderfully friendly staff if you chat a bit and have a laugh with them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anastasy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the center of Rome ,walking distance to so many of Roma's attractions The room was small, but nice.Breakfast is typical continental fayre but perfectly adequate consisting of cereals, rolls, pastries, cold meats etc.The reception were kind and helpful. Highly reccomended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nikos949
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 and we stayed in a 4 bed room for 3 nights. The hotel is located in the center of Rome and our room was extremely quite. The reception and all the people there , offered great service and were very friendly .

Reviews.Title: “Miami is a superb location”
Reviews.Author: Jen1D
Reviews.Content: Have previously stayed in Roma but in a hotel which required a taxi ride to the main attractions. The Miami is in a perfect location and is in walking distance to so many of Roma's attractions - you'll save a fortune on taxis!! The breakfast is slightly above the basic Italian standard of just coffee and the rolls are fab. The rooms are quite small but you'll hardly spend any time in them as there's so much to see. Would highly recommend this place (we're going again in a few months!!) but mind your head on the door !!! x

Reviews.Title: “Good base for exploring rome”
Reviews.Author: SunLuvaUK
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at the Miami hotel for 2 nights from the 22nd August for my 21st birthday. We booked the hotel back in January as I worked for Thomas Cook and I found it as a bargain! The hotel was in a good location for exploring Rome but we had a lot to fit in within 2 days! The bed wasnt very comfy but we still slept ok, the breakfast wasnt brilliant but we only ate there once and went to McDonalds the second morning as it was only at the end of the street. The staff at the hotel were nice, but becareful as the English isnt very good. We had a problem with out return transfers (which we had already booked through Thomas Cook before went) we asked reception to ring the taxi company Thomas Cook uses and arrange for us to get picked up the following day. When we was picked up the next day the driver who also spoke very little English drove us to the airport, once at the airport he gave us our cases and as we walked away held his hand out!! We tried to explain we had payed and showed him our receipt and invoice, he got a policeman over who also didnt understand us! Luckily they got a member staff from AIitalia who understood so we was ok but it was quite scary as we had no money left! It turned reception had booked us a private taxi! We visited the Colosseum which was fantastic, we was dissapointed outside the colosseum WATCH THE TWO ROMAN MEN DRESSED AS GLADIATORS!! We wanted a photograph so they posed with us, had the photo taken with my own camera then charged us £20 each!!! Gutted! We laughed afterwards but I think it was the shock! Lol! Also visited the Vatican City which was stunning id recommend you get up early and go first thing it gets very busy, also visited Castel Sant' Angelo, the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain which was lovely. I'd definetly go back, maybe for longer next time, and learn a bit of Italian beforehand!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a city break”
Reviews.Author: Persicm
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Miami for 3 nights. This is the fourth time that I have stayed at the hotel with the experience highly satisfactory on each occasion. The hotel is situated on Via Nazionale c. 1/2 mile from Termini train station and the bus dop off point (from Ciampino Airport). The location is very central and most of the main historical sights are within walking distance. Rooms are fairly basic, of average size, and very clean. Our bathroom was quite small and only had a shower but that was perfectly fine for us. It looked as if the hotel had recent undergone a refurbishment. Breakfast is typical continental fayre but perfectly adequate consisting of cereals, rolls, pastries, cold meats etc. Overall, I would highly recommend Hotel Miami and would have no hesitation in staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible rooms, terrible beds.”
Reviews.Author: Antonio_spaulo
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Rome with a friend and we stayed 3 nights in the Miami Hotel. The only good thing about the hotel is the location. The room was old style with very narrow beds, noisy, and the cleaning was far away from reasonable. The hotel is inside a comercial building and only parts of the building is occupied by the hotel's rooms. And the price is over rated. I believe the hotel is a one star.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant ending”
Reviews.Author: afds
Reviews.Content: I made a booking at Hotel Miami for my young nephew, based primarily on its location and the good reviews on TA. I contacted the hotel, both telephonically and by email, giving my credit card details and authorising payment for his stay, and received email confirmation from the hotel that everything was in order. Unfortunately, when my nephew checked out early in the morning, the clerk at reception claimed to be unaware of these arrangements and was extremely rude, threatening to confiscate my nephew's baggage if he didn't pay the bill, and delaying his departure for the airport. Eventually he was persuaded to search through his papers, found the authorisation and settled the payment, but he put my nephew through a horrible experience, which will remain as a very unpleasant memory of Rome. I am particularly annoyed because I had taken every precaution to avoid problems with payment, with all the different hotels that my nephew stayed in all over Italy. The only place he had a problem in was Hotel Miami, Rome. Would I recommend this hotel? Never!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: chrisp1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for only one night at this hotel due to cost although wish we could have stayed for whole duration of trip here as location was excellent and was easy to find from Termini Station. Rooms were very spacious in comparison to other Rome hotels and were clean with good air conditioning and working safe. Staff on reception were very friendly and made us very welcome from checking in giving maps and information for getting around Rome. Breakfast was average with limited selection in a cramped area. Had to ask the staff to clear tables which were full of used plates/cups to be able to sit down, which they did eventually although with a lot of reluctance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Uilleann
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a busy city street, close to the metro station and most of the famous tourist attractions. There's a large convenience store one block down the street, a pharmacy, some restaurants and an ATM - but be prepared for a lot of ambulance sirens and exhaust pipe smoke. Rome is unbelievably dirty but the hotel is very clean - you notice the difference as soon as you step in (or out). The staff were very friendly and helpful, and the "continental" breakfast was OK (good enough to keep you full until lunchtime). As noted in the other reviews, the elevator is tiny and slow; the corridors are narrow so don't bring too much luggage. The room had excellent A/C, double windows keeping out the noise, and a hard bed which is a matter of taste - we liked it. There's a color TV but all channels are in Italian (they don't use subtitles, even foreign films are dubbed). The ensuite bathroom, however, totally ruined the fun. First of all, the light inside the bathroom is on a timer. There's some kind of sensor in there, and after a few minutes the light just stops! There's another light which you can turn on, if you know you're supposed to do it, and it stays on (but the vent stops with the first light). It's not fun to start a shower and then be left in the dark. The tiny bathtub itself is a disaster, reminiscent of a medieval torture device. It is separated from the rest of the room by a glass screen door, getting in and out requires some athletic skill; and once you're in, you can't stand - this is because the floor of the tub is entirely concave, there's no straight surface to put your bare feet on - hard to describe, but very painful. If you're skinny and under 5 ft tall you can probably sit in it, otherwise there's no room for your legs. Absolutely terrible, especially when you're tired after a day of walking in the city. One last thing - either this hotel is built on top of a volcano, or the foundations are rubbish - the bed vibrates from time to time, it feels like the beginning of an earthquake.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Miami”
Reviews.Author: Essextrippers
Reviews.Content: Hi, All. Stayed at The Miami 25th to 28th August 2008.All the prevoius reviews are correct. The staff including Valentina and Mario were excellent,good advise and travel tips,and a local exchange shop with no commision and a great rate. The rooms are large with a shower and bath with all the little extras.Clean towels every day, air con: mini bar and a FREE in room digital safe. Breakfast has a good chice of meats,cheese,juice,coffee and wonderful cakes with yoghurts and lovely rolls..This place is a better 3* thank in the U.K.. I would reccommend this and would return.Easy walking distance to the station and all of Rome's sights. Well done Hotel Miami Rome.

Reviews.Title: “MMM not so sure about this one”
Reviews.Author: Balding_Bon_Viveur
Reviews.Content: I broke a golden rule here as I really struggled to get a cheap hotel in Rome, for reasons unclear, and booked direct through a high street travel agent. It still wasnt especially cheap, but slightly less so than the web prices. Like many other Italian hotels I have stayed in this is in fact part of a large apartment block (19th Century) given over to a hotel, and while you get a bit of ambience of being in a Roamn townhouse with the polished wood, and large foyet entracne to the building the hotel is cramped. The lift is tiny, and the corridors tinier still to move your luggage round. The reception id also very small. Rooms were ok, but rather tired. Breakfast was appalling by Italian standards with some of the worst coffee I hav ever drunk there, and some pretty awful pastries. There are better hotels than this, although the staff were nice, and overall it was clean. Location wise you wont get a lot better as it is about 10 minutes walk to the tube station, or 20-30 minutes wlak to the forum.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Miami, Rome - mid 30's couple from Ireland.”
Reviews.Author: alanbucko
Reviews.Content: Hotel Miami is ideally suited in the centre of Rome on Via Nazionale. We spent 3 nights there in August 2008 and it was an ideal base for exploring Rome. It is within walking distance of most of the major tourist attractions apart from the Vatican which is a short bus ride away on bus 40 or 64. The hotel is about 30 mins by Taxi from Ciampino airport and costs about €40 for a one way trip. Be prepared for some typical Italian driving with the taxi drivers!! Over taking into oncoming traffic is a speciality! The area the hotel is located in is very good, safe and relatively quiet at night time. There are plenty of shops in the locality and loads of lovely restaurants on the side streets used by locals and also a few bars (and yes there is an Irish pub!). The Via Nazionale can be busy during the day and they were re-laying the cobblestones while we were there. I'd advise you to e-mail the hotel in advance and request a quiet room at the back of the hotel like we did. It looks out on to a car park and some other apartment blocks. Hotel staff were friendly and accommodated any requests we had with a smile. The reception area is small, but the room and ensuite were spotless with TV, aircon, safe and mini bar. The room was a good size with tiled floors which were great for cooling the room in the August heat. It was over 38 degrees C the day we arrived so the aircon in the room really did the job. There is an adequate continental breakfast served on the 5th floor including a good selection of ham/salami/cheese, cereals, juices, tea/coffee, bread and pastries. More than enough for a light breakfast before setting out for the day. We'd thoroughly recommend the Hotel Miami as a base for exploring the beautiful city of Rome and will definitely use it again if we return to Rome some day in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Teresa33
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really excellent value for money. We had a quiet room on the 5th floor which was away from the main road. It was near enough to walk everywhere. The staff were helpful. We bought a three day bus pass and made the most of it. The breakfast was fine - buffet as much as you could eat. I would recommend this hotel as a good budget hotel and we found our bed very comfortable. We are in our 60's.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Sainesfish
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days in May and we found the staff very friendly. When I said I was visiting with my Mum and could we have a quite, twin room they obliged. They speak good English and are very helpful in answering all questions. The location is very central - so you can easily walk to the Station, Colleseum and Trevi Fountain. Everything else is easily reached by taking the bus (there are bus stops all along Via Nazionale) which is where the hotel is situated. The room had everything you needed and the bathroom was very nice. The only problem were the very hard mattresses! I would definately recommend to anybody looking for a good value for money hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: poppynz
Reviews.Content: Central to train station, shops, and central rome. only one lift though so slow waiting for it sometimes. Breakfast great.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Miami - excellent 3*”
Reviews.Author: Gusboy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from a Friday to a Sunday and were pleasantly surprised at the quality of the hotel, especially our room. Our room was pleasantly decorated with a great view over Via Nazionale! Bed firm but ok. Bathroom had a shower which was very small but ok. Hairdryer. Aircon was adequate. Via Nazionale is always busy with a real `buzz' though our room was lovely and quiet once we closed the window. Breakfast is simple continental but very adequate. The hotel is just 10-mins walk from main bus terminal. Hotel is in a great location to explore Rome. We used buses alot but beware though we had no problems we were told to be aware of pickpockets which you have to watch out for everywhere in Rome. There is a church opposite the Hotel (can't recall name) but they sell tickets for `operas' which are held there which we most higly recommend - I nearly cried it was so beautiful and the tickets were very reasonably priced. Some of the best eateries are those located off the main road, the authentic family-run-type establishments. Rome is beautiful though we were shocked at the graffitti everywhere, cigarette stubs and rubbish but if you can see past all of this then you wont be disappointed. We don't recommend driving, the roads are scary and people don't pay attention to traffic lights (same goes for both pedestrians and drivers). You can purchase bus tickets cheap enough from the multitude of news-stands located on the pavements. Check Vatican times - we tried 3 times to get in to see the famous Michael Angelo paintings and couldn't get in which was a little disappointing and don't forget to cover up your arms and legs as they have a strict `no flesh' code! All in all, Hotel Miami is a great 3* base in which to explore Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Close to most sights”
Reviews.Author: WightSurrey
Reviews.Content: Well placed hotel. Bedroom good bathroom small - squeeze into the shower but OK. If you're travelling from the airport go by train to the Termini, it's only a 10 min. walk from the hotel. Breakfast good and you can ask and get proper coffee rather than the machine sort. Close to Piazza Venezia, Quirinale, Coliseum, the Forum and plenty else. Staff friendly and helpful. Lift is small and slow but gets there in the end.

Reviews.Title: “pleased ive been and seen but wouldnt rush back”
Reviews.Author: newfmum
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was lovely , the staff were very helpful and friendly. I just found Rome as beautiful and cultural as it is, very expensive and rather dirty.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location and staff but...”
Reviews.Author: MelissaLondon
Reviews.Content: Hotel Miami has the most amazing, accommodating staff! They will help you with directions, meals, attractions...anything you need they will attend to! The location is ideal, centrally located to the fountain of Trevi, Spainish stairs, Colluseum, Forum, and the Metro and Central Train Terminal are right at the end of the block which will take you directly to the Vatican. However, if the windows are open in your room for fresh air, you are on one of the busiest streets in Rome and the noise is very loud! The rooms are clean but I can tell you that after a long day of sight seeing the beds are HORRIBLE to sleep on. It was like sleeping on the floor...hard as a rock! My back was killing me so badly that after the first night the management brought me in another mattress to try (they were very nice about it). My husband is in the military and is used to sleeping on ANYTHING and after four nights in this hotel HIS BACK was really hurting! The staff and it's friendly service made up for this situation, but for those travellers who need a comfy bed, this is not going to work for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JimbobberUk
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through British Airways and were really not expecting too much for the price we payed. We were really only looking for somewhere central in Rome to sleep and rest, and that is what we got, but it was in a great location to see all the sights and the building itself was impressive too. The room was spotless, everyone who we saw that worked at the hotel was polite and spoke great English and the breakfast was a lot better than we have had on other trips. And yes, the shower was on the small side to get in and out of, but I'm 6'2 and managed!!! We would certainly recommend this hotel to friends, and would stay there again happily!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly welcome”
Reviews.Author: deekay99
Reviews.Content: Well placed on the Via Nazionale about 10 minutes walk from Termini. Reception staff very welcoming, & helpful throughout our stay. Room comfortable & double glazed, cutting out most of the street noise. (Quite noisy with windows open) Bathroom tight fit but all essentials Good self service breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Parrothead_at_heart
Reviews.Content: For a 3-Star hotel in central Rome, we couldn't have asked for anything better. The Coleseum is a 10 minute walk, the Metro station is a 5 minute walk, and there are taxis everywhere. There were a couple of good restaurants within a block or two. Nice, clean rooms, that were bigger than I expected. Breakfast was good and filling (surprisingly good cappucino from the machine), and since it was open for over 2 hours, it was very convenient. Great people at the front desk, they made all the reservations for us that we needed to make. Nothing to do at the hotel, but as you are staying in downtown Rome, I don't expect that is what you'd be looking for. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpfull staff and good rooms”
Reviews.Author: CopenhagenVisitor
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay via the Hotel website, and immeadiately we got a nice response from the staff. Upon arrival they did everything they could to make our stay a good experience. One of us had a bad back, and couldn't use the new matresses, and at once they found another one for us. The rooms were cosy, nice and clean, and the most important thing in January was, that the heating worked very well. Breakfast was quite nice with coffee, tea, juice and different kind of bread, danish, yoghurt and cereals. We recommend this hotel very much for a holiday in Rome both for couples as well as for families with kids. It is well situated, so it is easy to get around and it is easy to get there from the airport by train and a little walk. Furthermore you find supermarkets very close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mika08
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife visited Rome for 5 days and booked to stay at the Miami Hotel through a travel agent in the UK. What attracted us to the hotel in the first place is the great location it says on its brochure and the good reviews i've read on this site and they're completely true. Its location is perfect, very convenient if you want to see the major sites by foot (we only used the Metro once). We came prepared with a map but the the map the man at the hotel reception gave us was more detailed which was a great help. Hotel receptionists are very pleasant, helpful and speak English well (which is a bonus). We are greatly pleased with the hotel room, its cleanliness is at high standards. Nothing to complain about. The only downside is the TINY shower area, you really have to squeeze in to get in it, and I could hear quite clearly the other occupant's cough at the next room. The breakfast was quite adequate, very typical Italian (croissants, cold ham and cheese, cereal, etc.), though it could get a bit better. Hotel staff should realize that majority of hotel occupants are tourists from all over the world so there should be a lot more choices - a bit of bacon, sausages and toast won't hurt. If you want to know a nice place to eat in ask the hotel staff and take their word for it, they sure know what they're talking about. TIP: go to a ristorante/pizzeria where it says "pizzeria forno a legno" (baked in traditional wooden fire) and it won't disappoint you. The hotel is safe too, it closes to all entrants at 2030H but you can always ring the reception to be let in. Yes, I would recommend a friend to stay at this hotel in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring the city”
Reviews.Author: Cotehele
Reviews.Content: Each December we visit a European Capitol city in December to celebrate the birthday of one of our small group of travellers who make frequent trips abroad during the course of the year. This December we decided to re-visit Rome. Accomodation was aquired at The Miami Hotel,Rome by going direct to the hotel.Their response was both positive and efficient and without problems, the booking was completed. Just prior to leaving, we received an email from a Rome based company who offered transport (at 70 Euros)from the airport to the hotel. We declined this invitation as we intended to use public transport(one of our 'things' when we go abroad is to use local facilities). However, a few days before leaving, I contacted the hotel and arranged direct with them, for transport from the airport to the hotel at a cost of 60 Euros(the bus fares would have been 48 Euros). The taxi driver met us as per arrangements and the transfer to the hotel took place. The hotel itself is set on one of the main roads that go thro' the city. It is a buzzing thoroughfare which adds to the delights of visiting this location. The reception given was, as before, warm and obliging.Our rooms were not overly large but were adequatef or what we needed. The bed was extremely comfortable and cleanliness was of the highest order. Breakfast was adequate and met with the description given on the booking. If you are looking for a large hot breakfast, this is not the place to visit. But for an adequate and well presented continental breakfast , with a range of breads, meats, cheese etc, it was all that we required. The reception staff were, as always, extremely helpful with providing information concerning tours and eating places. We visited two resturants that we found on our last visit. Ristorante Quirino is excellent to celebrate a special occasion. A visit to the Vatican was a must and on this occasion the audiance with the Pope was held inside in the large hall. Access to the hall is gained by requesting entrance tickets from the Swiss guards who have handfuls to pass out (free). On our departure, we used the hotel taxi service which cost 50 Euros(why the difference I have no idea). Hotel Miami is an excellent, clean and homely hotel, ideally situated for exploring the city high light on foot. If we make a return visit, that will be our base yet again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in great city”
Reviews.Author: Trevi07
Reviews.Content: Just had a three night break in Rome with my 12 year old son all booked through British Airways. Having travelled a lot on business, I was not expecting too much from three star hotel in a major city. I could not have been more wrong. The Miami is an excellent hotel at any price and the price was incredibly reasonable given its central location. I could not see how anyone could give this hotel less than an 'Above average' or 'Excellent' rating. It really is very good and very comfortable, The staff are friendly and helpful, the continental breakfast is perfectly adequate for the hungry tourist and the location simply could not be better. My son and I rate this as one of the very best trips we have ever been on. Rome is a magnificent city but, no matter how good a place might be, if you have to return to a less than satisfactory hotel your overall experience will not be good. This is absolutely not the case with the Miami which was a delight and a haven to return to. We will go again to Rome I am sure, and the Miami will be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “An odd but good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gez_egen
Reviews.Content: Hotel Miami is the most bizarre hotel we've been. You enter an office building, the reception is a small room at the left. Then you go upstairs inside office building and you pass a door which is closed after 8pm to go to your room. You have to ring the bell to get in if you are late. We've been at 5th floor close to breakfast room. Altough the strange layout, the hotel is quite good. The location is superb, very close to Repubblica metro station an 10 minute walk to Termini Station. You can walk everywhere except Vatican which you can go by metro. Mc Donalds is nearby, 10 minute walk to Via Veneto where you can have quality food and 15 minute walk to Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and Forum. The room is quite spacious and clean, floor is marble. The bathroom is ok but there is no bath tub only a shower bath. The hotel staff is quite helpful and friendly. The breakfast is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Special place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jerod26
Reviews.Content: I' ve been in Italy for the first time and i have used Tripadvisor to choose all the hotels of my trip. Excellent idea!!! But overall i liked Hotel Miami in which i've been for one week. The room we had was spacious and clean, breakfast was good compared to the Italian standars. The location is excellent and just in the middle of everywhere. But most than everything was the care and the attitude of staff, they assisted me and answered to all my requestes. I will come back there for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for exploring Rome on foot.”
Reviews.Author: OKIEokc
