Reviews.Content: After spending a week in the Tuscany region, we ended up in Rome for 4 nights, staying at the Hotel Miami. We had a 4th floor room facing the main street, the Via Nationale, but we had no problems with noise. The hotel is located within a 10 minute walk from the Roma Termini (the main train station in Rome) and within easy walking distance to all the main sites in Rome, except maybe Vatican City. It's a 15 minute walk to the Colossem one direction and maybe 20 minutes to the Spanish Steps the opposite direction. The staff is great, especially Mario who works the desk during the day. He is a real character and was probably the friendliest person we met in italy. The included continental breakfast was nice and the room was very clean, although somewhat small. Nice clean tile floors throughout the room but the bathroom was somewhat small with a unique, but very small, shower stall. The Via Nationale is one of the main shopping streets in Rome and there are numerous restaurants in any direction. This was our first visit to Rome, so we were surprised at the fact that most of the buildings are less than 6-8 stories and most are hundreds of years old. All the restaurants/shops are small establishments in remodeled first floor areas of really old buildings. When you're in Rome, you won't be spending, or at least we didn't spend, a great deal of time in a hotel room so to stay in a much more expensive hotel with more amentities didn't make sense to us. The hotel is clean and is located in a nice, safe, and very convenient area of Rome. I highly recomment it to anyone trying to maximize their travel budget as we were.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: Scotslass2
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a short break in Rome and the facilities at the Miami were more than adequate for our needs. Location's excellent - practically everywhere you'd want to go is within walking distance and there's a small supermarket closeby where you can buy almost anything. Breakfast was self-service - cereals, cheese, cold meats, bread rolls, yoghurt - as much as you could eat really so no need to go hungry! Our room was clean, well air-conditioned and, although overlooking a busy main street, not particularly noisy. The shower cubicle WAS tiny though, bit difficult to turn around in! I think we'd go back to the Miami - it made a good base for a brilliant holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, but check your credit card statements!!”
Reviews.Author: Cel_7
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed at the Hotel Miami, Rome in April 2007. We travelled to Rome to attend a friend's wedding and alot of our friends who were also wedding guests stayed at the Hotel Miami. We found the hotel to be very clean and the staff were friendly. The hotel is in an excellent location, within easy walking distance to the Colusseum, Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps although we did get a taxi to the Vatican (not that expensive when shared between 4 or 5 people). The breakfast was not great, but there are so many cafes along the Via Nazionale and other side streets that it didnt bother us. We booked the hotel through the hotel's website using our credit card but we didnt even take the credit card to Rome with us as we had no need of it. June 2007 I checked my credit card statement and found that 2 transactions had been made in Turin, Italy for that month. We have never been to Turin and were not in Italy in June!! We gave the hotel the benefit of the doubt thinking that our card details could have been obtained over the internet. However we just learned that a friend who also stayed at this hotel at the same time as us has had transactions made in Italy on his credit card for the start of september when he was not in Italy! This may be a coincidence but just beware!!

Reviews.Title: “Miami in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Cassiya
Reviews.Content: The one big positive about this hotel is the location. The metro is a stone's throw away, however all the main attractions are within walking distance. Reception are very friendly and willing to help you. The room does the job, although I found the bathroom abit of squeeze. Overall a very fine stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Roma”
Reviews.Author: mikahaga
Reviews.Content: Landed yesterday after five wonderful days in Roma. The staff and hotel are wonderful. The entrance may seem strange to others, but after walking around the city, there are many hotels and office like this. It is an old city after all, using the space to the most advantage seems to be the order of the day. Breakfast was fine, it was very busy at the weekend but fresh food was bought out very quickly, tables changed straight away. All very professional. We had no problems with lights or air-con, the power is active when you place the key in a slot in the wall. A great way to get the children away from MTV. A mimi-supermarket is nearby, gift shops, very fit street-sellers (when the Polizia appear. We only caught the Met.Ro, one euro for 75 mins travel and as many buses as you want in this time, to go to St.Peter's. The rest of the time we walked around and took in the sights. I recommend the church down the road. Open on Sunday. Go down the steps. It is beautiful. Make sure the service has finished first though, there is a notice. The beggars leave you alone, we did not feel threatened once. The sellers are quite vocal, but if you say no they leave you alone. Just try not to catch their eye. All in all, after slight worries, we enjoyed ourselves and are going to be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at affordable prices”
Reviews.Author: GalatiIndian
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located centrally.. From Termini station, we took a taxi at Eur 7 to go to the hotel. It takes 10 minutes to walk. We reached the hotel at 9 a.m. - well before the checkin time. We had our one year old kid and Mario was kind enough to allow us use the lobby (a very small one indeed) to prepare food for him and feed him. We forgot our camera and he suggested a good place to buy them. He also advised us to visit some nearby places. The city was very hot - it was 37 degrees - AC was good.. As our son was tired due to heat, he slept till 7 p.m. and when we went to the front desk, Sonia suggested to go to Spanish steps - we could not forget that as we had a portrait of our son prepared there - it was wonderful. The room was also very good - spacious. The only problems being the flush used by the neighbour and the small shower. Otherwise it was worth staying. We stayed in another 4 star hotel in Venice which was worse than this. Though the entrance and breakfast is not that good, but it is worth to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Not too impressed.”
Reviews.Author: Elskin
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews, I thought Hotel Miami would be a good choice. But we weren't too impressed. The hotel is NOT really within walking distance to any of the sights. We took the subway to most places. The hotel has a weird entrance. Very limited breakfast hours. You must leave the key with front desk everytime you go in/out. Extremely difficult procedure of getting lights/AC on. One female at front desk recommended a very bizarre place for having dinner. We were so elegantly dressed and she sent us to a very casual, run down part of city. One male at the front desk is very arrogant and almost enjoyed making remarks that we are not from Europe (he is dumb, I AM from Europe! but currently live in NY). The one we did like is Fransesco!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful front desk”
Reviews.Author: MapleLeafwonderer
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent. When there was a 24 hour train strike, posted at short notice, Mario on the front desk searched the internet for us for other options. He pulled up a list of buses to Macerata, with times and the tel. number for the bus station. Unfortunately you have to go to the bus station to book buses but Mario and the other front desk personnel did not hesitate to help us. Rooms are clean and functional. There is a supermarket a few doors down. I stayed at this hotel after reading great reviews on this website. I would definately recommend this hotel to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Miami in Rome?”
Reviews.Author: Ohjustpeachy
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is good and within walking distance of most tourist attractions - approx 15 min to Colosseum! The staff were helpful. The double room was spacious and comfortable but the bathroom was awkward to use and get into (could've been just our room) . We overlooked the main street but the noise didn't prevent us sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Irish Wedding”
Reviews.Author: IrelandJules
Reviews.Content: We were travelling to Rome to get married on Wed 13th June and decided on this Hotel as it had such good reviews. The service given to us by the staff was excellent at all times they were so helpful. As we were organising the wedding over the internet it was hard to sort hairdressers (etc) but i rang the Hotel and they organised this for me. They also organised a Bus to collect us from the Airport as there was 20 of us travelling for the wedding. The staff organised tours for us to Vatican City etc. Breakfast was serviced every morning with Cereals, Bread Rolls, Crossiants, orange or grapefruit juice, ham, cheese and a selection of tea and coffee, they had something for all tastes. The cleaniness of the Hotel was excellent, and we would recommend this Hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay - good location, clean hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Connie2003
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a 3-night stay at Hotel Miami for our first visit to Rome. The hotel is in a good location - we walked to all the major sites (comfortable shoes are a must). The front desk staff was helpful and the room was very clean. Our room faced Via Nazionale but the windows kept the noise out. The A/C in the room is also strong although you need to give it some time. We also thought the breakfast was good considering it was included in the price of our stay - cheese and meats, cereal, pastries, and fruit rounded out the selection. We would definitely recommend this hotel to others and would stay there again. If you have time, stop by DoveralU cafe down the street for a drink or dessert - it was our spot to unwind every evening before dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldtravler30
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights in May. The location was good. It is within walking distance from the train station, ancient rome, trevi fountain and the spanish steps. It is also close to a metro stop for easy access to the vatican. the room was on the small size, but comfortable and clean. Our fourth floor room windown opened up on to via nationziale, but with the windows shut there was very little road noise. There is a safe, a minibar fridge, tv and phone, but no clock or alarm. The bathroom was a good size, athough the shower was a bit narrow. In line with the size of other hotels I've stayed at throughout Italy. Breakfast was fine. Not the best I have had in Italy, but a lot of variety. Meets, rolls, pastries, yogurt, cereal and a coffee machine. The breakfast room is not large, but we never had any problems getting a table. The front desk staff was always pleasant and we had no problems checking in or out.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job - wells”
Reviews.Author: lcj1031
Reviews.Content: Overall we were impressed with the hotel for a city centre, major tourist destination hotel. It is close to all the major sites, the furthest one being the Vatican which took us about an hour to walk to but we took our time and visited a couple of other sites on the way. The room was quite large and clean and contrary to some of the reviews I've seen on here the bathroom was also large with a good shower. The staff were very helpful, especially when we first arrived and when we checked out (the receptionist forgot to add on our mini-bar bill to the tab (only 2 EUR for a can of Peroni) so he let us off as we had left all of our change for the chambermaid as a tip!) We did have a couple of criticisms of the hotel though - there was not a clock or coffee facilities in the room (although you could request a wake-up call and room service if necessary), the breakfast room was too small (although the breakfast provided was very much in line with other hotels on the continent) and the layout of the rooms was quite strange in that the the bathroom of the room next-door was to the rear of the wardrobe and jutted out into our room so whenever they were using the facilities we could hear pretty much everything they were doing and their extract fan was very loud - it would be better if the bathroom for our room had been there instead. We were on the fourth floor of the hotel overlooking the main street. There was some noise from the cars on the street below (mainly due to the fact it was cobbled like most of the roads in Rome and therefore there was lost of tyre noise) but it was Ok with the window closed at night. There are a few good restaurants in the area but you have to go off the main street to find them. We would definitely recommend this hotel to our friends and family and in fact when we book a trip to Rome as a surprise 60th birthday present for my mother-in-law we will book her into this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Col07
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is well located for visiting the main sites in Rome. The room was very clean and the shower room was excellant with fresh towels every day. The reception staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was fine with a good choice although it could get crowded. Our room overlooked the main shopping street but with the windows closed there was no noise. Recommended for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely terrible”
Reviews.Author: brj_nz
Reviews.Content: What's to like? Cold showers, very noisy room (both traffic noise from the busy street below, and sound from other guests on the marble floored corridor), a bed that was so hard we had to check it had a mattress, and breakfast that was in a cramped little room with 30 other guests and cardboard pastries. We've travelled a lot in Europe and the UK and usually spend around €80-150 a night, depending on the location. We thought we had picked a nice hotel from the location description, but apart from a 15 minute walk to the spanish steps there is actually no where decent to eat around here for lunch or dinner, except for McDonalds and places even the average-american-cruise-ship-tourist would feel too naff in. The person on reception was nice enough, but wouldn't let us check in 15 minutes early (instead had to leave our bags and come back later), and on day 2 when we returned at 3.00 after a big day out looking at sights, they still hadn't made up our room! I personally had about 3-4 hours sleep the whole weekend. Would highly discourage anyone from staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Central, Inexpensive, Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: mickeycireland
Reviews.Content: It's at most a ten minute walk from the central train station (where the bus from the airport stops). It's on one of the main shopping streets which leads directly to the historic region (colosseum, forums etc) and there's a mtero stop at the top of the street (four minute walk). The hotel is on three floors of an old style european building on the main street. The reception is on the ground floor with an elevator to the rooms on the upper floors. The rooms themselves were slightly small but very clean and comfortable with a tv and mini bar. Bathroom was very clean and shower was fine. The building is very safe and secure. Breakfast is included in the price and proved to be a wonderful start to the day. Breakfast was basic but plentiful. Cereal, orange juice, tea coffee, bread, pastries, yoghurt, meat and cheese, as much as you like. We booked a room to the back of the hotel to avoid the noise form the street outside although this may not be necessary as the windows are double glazed and well insulated. One slight drawback might be that the walls of the room are not very well insulated from noise from adjacent rooms and corridors, if you're a light sleeper this may be an issue. I thoroughly enjoyed the visit and would certainly stay in the hotel miami again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel room OK, but main entrance a bit off-putting - dark and grimy!”
Reviews.Author: Noeliz
Reviews.Content: Basic hotel on a very busy main road but convenient for the Metro (five minute walk). Could be noisy so you might want to request a quiet room. The main facility it lacked for us was a comfortable lounge area for relaxing/recovering after a full day's sightseeing. Breakfast was mediocre, typical processed slices of ham and cheese and horrible fruit juice which was probably powdered stuff. Also, although the gentleman on the desk was very nice and helpful, the two ladies in the breakfast room were a bit scary and quite unfriendly. I'm afraid to say that if I visit Rome again, I wouldn't stay at the Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, would recommend to a friend.”
Reviews.Author: blackandwhitefatfred
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Miami from 22nd Feb 2007 for 5 nights. I agree with all the positives written by previous visitors, excellent location, friendly staff, clean room, a safe, good shower, reasonable breakfast. For the price we paid, €100 a night inc breakfast, it was just what we expected. We made sure to book a room at the back and it was very peaceful. Loads of good restaurants within a short stroll but the little gem was about 300 metres away, across the road and down the sidestreet that has the Timberland shop on the corner. It was called Angelo di Napoli. Had the feel of a family run restaurant, excellent food and wine and very reasonable prices. Closer and slightly more expensive was Zeus, another good restaurant. Rome itself was brilliant, we spent 5 days sightseeing, saw as many of the sights as we could. DON'T take a taxi from the station to the hotel, it's no more than a 6 or 7 minute walk. There are police everywhere in Rome so walking even if you arrive at night should be OK. Take a red open top tour bus to see the sights, they run every 15 or 20 mins and stop at all the main attractions, you can hop on and off as many times as you want during the day. It will save blisters. There is a green bus that goes out of town to the catacombs and aquaduct as well as many other sights. Both run from the bus station at the front of the Terminii Station. Other tips ? Take a larger suitcase than you need. The value and quality in mens suits, shirts, ties and overcoats is excellent. Oh and try the hot chocolate at one of the older more traditional type restaurants, tastes like a melted down Galaxy bar mixed with milk, definitely one of the highlights.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Croagh
Reviews.Content: Brought my Mum to this hotel for Xmas and its was perfect to all sights, Bus station 5 minutes walksroom was perfect, bathroom excellent and breakfast good, my mother loved the croissants!! The staff were very friendly and Sonia was very helpful organising a taxit to see the pope as we were late (which only cost 11 euros. from the hotel) Mario helped us pick out restaurants for the evening time and we could not fault his choice. Clothes I found to be very cheap so bring an empty bag. The whole experience was brilliant and this hotel is a perfect stay. I will travel back to Rome and will stay in this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Handy location in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: Cockers
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as part of a deal through British Airways website and chose it due to reasonably good reviews and location. Hotel is fairly close to the main train station so once we arrived in on the train from the airport (on the Leonardo Express, direct in 30 mins), we decided to walk to the hotel. Best option I felt if you have a relatively decent map to hand as it is only a 10-15 minute walk from the station and heard some stories about the taxis trying to charge extortionate prices to tourists. Room was OK as it had the necessities (double bed, wardrobes, safe, fridge, bathroom) but can see what some people have said about it being small. We thought it was ideal for what we were after as we weren't planning on spending a great deal of time in the room anyway. That aside, it was perfectly spotless and cleaned thoroughly with fresh sheets awaiting our return each day...suitably impressed to leave a good tip at the end of our stay for the cleaners. We were on the 4th floor overlooking the road and when the windows are closed, no noise was heard at all from the busy road below. Of course when the window was opened though, this all changed but again, that didn't bother us as we slept with the window closed and only opened it when we came back in of an evening to allow some fresh air in before heading back out again. Bathroom was decent with a fantastic shower which was lovely and warm and very inviting to jump into after a hard day of sightseeing. Breakfast was adequate with the standard selection of pastries, cereals and rolls and we certainly had plenty to keep us going for the morning. Reception staff were very friendly and helpful, advising us of the best routes to take for certain attractions and times to visit. Didn't notice what some people were on about with respect to the smell once the main door was closed - we came back late each night to come through the small door and didn't notice a thing!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Hotel Miami”
Reviews.Author: Catalonia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights in February half-term and had a wonderful time. We were in room 529 on 5th floor and faced away from the road (so no traffic noise which I think you could expect if you were facing the busy road). Took the Leonardo Express train from the airport into Rome Termini station, costing 11E. The worst part of our stay was being charged 25E in a taxi to get from the station to the hotel. Our fault for not querying it at the time, but you don't know when you first arrive. It wasn't until we got a taxi back on our last day and we were charged 8E that we felt ripped off!! Room fairly small but has everything you need, except tea and coffee making facilities. Safe was very useful. Bathroom fine, even had a bidet. Breakfast was fine, tea/coffee, pastries, brioche, ham and cheese, cereals. All self-service. Never had a problem getting a table and we went at differnt times each day. Hotel is in a great location. About 15mins to the Colosseum. Had a great time here. Had a guided tour with a company who stand around the entrance. This was well worth it, costs 21E each instead of 11E and you get a 45min tour and you get to by-pass thye HUGE queue. The ticket also included guided tour of the Roman Forum and Palatine but this didn't start until about 2hours after we'd finished at the Colosseum, so we just went on by ourselves. Everywhere is within walking distance, as long as you don't mind lengthy walks. After the Colosseum we went to the Tomb of the Lost Soldier and Piazza Venetia, the Pantheon (free entry), Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona, along to the river, up to Piazza del Popolo, then the Pincio park and finally Spanish steps and then back to the hotel! Possibly not in this order, but you can see it is all do-able. Had a fab meal at Il Brillo Parlant on Via della Fontanella near Piazza del Popolo - great pizzas. Pizza and lasagne at Cavona on Piazza del Popolo were also good. Another great meal was at Cucina on Via Nazionale (walk left out of the hotel and it's on the other side of the road near Piazza Republica). Irish bar opposite hotel was also good. We spent a day doing the Vatican area. On Wednesdays you can go to the Papal audience,a good experience. Be aware that the Museums close at 1.45pm (last entry at 12.40pm), entry was 13E each. Had to queue about 40mins to get into St Peter's Basilica but it was worth it. We walked pretty much everywhere, but we did get the tube to the Vatican. There is a Metro station at the end of Via Nazionale (turn left out of the hotel and walk straight down about 5mins). Point to note - Loads and loads of beggars, women on their own, women with children and adults with disabilities, all either on the floor or shaking their bowl under your nose. Also, at Termini station when using self-service ticket machine to go back to the airport we couldn't work out where to feed our notes into; a man appeared from nowhere and pointed to the correct slot; then when our change dropped down he appeared again and asked for money. We didn't give him any and he walked away and then chcked all the other change slots. Be warned! We never felt unsafe at any time of day or night, but you have to be sensible and have your wits about you - Have your bag across your tummy rather than on your back, keep purses/ wallets out of your pockets etc. Witnessed a very amusing scene near St Peter's - loads of men selling sunglasses or handbags, all interspersed down the street. Then all of sudden they were off, with about 20 handbags along each arm and running into all the side streets! They'd obviously heard sirens or something, so they clearly weren't selling their wares legally!! This is a very long review for a 3-night trip, but hey we had a great time and hopefully the info here will help anybody who's considering going. Have a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Miami (Rome) - Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: cmh_org
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Miami is on a great street (Via Nazionale) and is convenient to a lot of stuff...but the room was terrible, noisy and not very comfortable. Breakfast was mediocre at best. The service in the breakfast room was terible. The receptionist was helpful and friendly. As a gay couple we felt comfortable checking in and staying at Hotel Miami...although when we go back to Rome we won't be staying at there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to explore the City”
Reviews.Author: JDBrighton
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recomended as a great central location and good value. The hotel has recently been refurbished so all the rooms have a fresh clean look. The historic building and the friendly staff made the whole experience a pleasant one. We arrived by train and were able to walk to the hotel in 10 minutes avoiding getting a cab and allowing us to get a feel for the city straight away. Located on a great shopping street you can walk everywhere you need to making this hotel a great base. The room was comfortable though the bathroom was very small. Requested a high room to avoid traffic noise and found the room lovely and quiet and very comfortable. I would recomend this hotel if you are looking for a convenient, good value for money, clean and friendly place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for the Price”
Reviews.Author: SightViewer
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel after some investigation (personal recommendations, Trip Advisor reviews, etc.). Having been 'scared' by some reviewers, referring to the showers as 'smallest possible' we asked for a room with a bath tub. So, may be one can use it as a suggestion (we do not know what the shower looked like, though). Our experience: Location - superb: under 20 minutes walking to major attractions; 40 minutes to St. Peter square in Vatican. (This was rather fast paced jogging, so, allow 1 hour of comfortable walk). Room - always clean. Fresh towels, soap, shampoo, etc. were replenished daily. Staff - very friendly. Breakfast – Ok, no thrill, but quite good to keep you until the lunch. Very good place for those on sightseeing. On the unrelated note: the 110 bus tour (‘hop on, hop off’) was waste of money. Unless you use it as a mean of transportation, which is not a good idea given the traffic, it is not tourist friendly. Very little information about the great city.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Decent Price”
Reviews.Author: Jon,Vin,Lyn
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel during my last leg of our Europe trip. We were from Singapore. Travelled with me wife and 4 years old son. Hotel itself and the room is ok with us. We had a large room and they have an unique lobby. Location is good. Walking distance to some historical buildings and shopping belt too. Near train station as well if you travel via night to Rome which we did. We were on the night train from Swizterland (Lucerne) to Rome. But if you will like to take a taxi from the train / airport to hotel, remember to sit those with meter. Someone approaches us for taxi (from train station to Hotel Miami), the starting price is 25 euro, I asked for 20 euro and they said no, so we decide to quene for the meter taxi and it cost us 8 euro. We saved 17 euro . Do booked a "hop on, hop off" us tour which will brings you to all places of interest. Note that Coloseum closes at 4.30pm. We missed the entrance time. We spent lots of time in St Peter Basilica. Beautiful place. Might stayed at Hotel Miami if we will to travel to Rome again but again it depends during that period of time. Enjoy and GOD Bless.

Reviews.Title: “For value only”
Reviews.Author: RandR-NL
Reviews.Content: Low price and decent location are the only reasons to consider this hotel. The bathroom was the smallest we've seen in Europe; the toilet was literally uncomfortable to use. The bed consisted of a thing springy but very hard mattress and did not make for a good night's sleep -- that is if you could get over the noise from the street side room (even with window shut). Staff was reasonably friendly, breakfast was OK, but if you're looking for comfort look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant weekend!”
Reviews.Author: cazzamole
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel for a long weekend and you could not fault anything. the location was right in the middle of everything. we flew with ryan air and bought Terrorvision coach tickets on flight. this was easy to find once outside the airport and got a coach to rome centre. have a map with you as its not easy to get from the train station to the hotel without it, even though its about a 10 minute walk, you still need a map. Our highlight of the weekend was visiting the coloseum. outside the coloseum there are people asking if you want a tour. Go with the guides that have official blue tour guide badges around their necks. you pay 21 euro per person and have a guided tour of the coloseum without queing to get in and 2 guided tours of the roman forum and palatine hill. this was well worth it. the roman forum and palatine hill are mind blowing and you need a guide to really get an idea of what its all about. We went on the open top bus 110 which is a 2 hour tour of the city and very good. the coloseum and trevi fountain are woth seeing a night as they look spectacular. We found a good restaurant called Wanted, which is down the road that runs from via nazionale to the coloseum. the food and service was brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “superb location”
Reviews.Author: kandra
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 nights at this hotel, we could not fault the location all the major tourist sites were within walking distance e.g. The Coloseum was 15 mins, the furthest away was The Vatican about 45 mins, but buses run along the Via Nazionale which take you there.They looked very crowded so we took the open top bus 110 which starts from the bus station, this way you see some of the major sites and arrive at the vatican fresh to climb to the top of St Peter's. The hotel is the top 3 stories of an office block with the reception on the ground floor. The rooms are clean and comfortable, with the all important safe to leave your valuables. There is a hairdryer and always plenty of clean fresh towels. The staff are all friendly and helpful. Breakfast is basic continental but with enough variety and the supplies were frequently refilled. The rooms on the back are quiet and whilst you don't have a view, neither do you have any traffic noise it is on a busy road. So if quiet is important ask for a room at the back. We arrived a little early to have access to our room straight away, so left our cases in reception, and went in search of refreshment, this we found at a restaurant cum bar on the road to the left as you come out of the hotel, it is recommended both for evening meals and day time snacks and drinks. The hotel is literally ten minutes walk from the coach drop off for the airport, allow a bit longer when you are catching the coach back, but don't waste money on a taxi, it really isn't necessary. This is one of the best hotels I have stayed in, in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Pasty-lass
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from our 3 night stay at the Miami Hotel, Rome. I'm a travel agent and after reading many reviews of hotels on this website I decided to book the Miami, and very glad I did! The hotel boasts an excellent location, just a 10 minute walk from Termini. Don't bother with a taxi as we were charged €15 for the very short journey. (We were tired so decided to catch one, but realising the distance involved wish we spent the money elsewere!) We flew with Easyjet from Bristol who I can also recommend with their prompt service and friendly staff. As we flew into Ciampino we made use of the Terravision coach which costs £9.50 per person return which for a 40 minute journey into the centre of Rome (drops you at Termini Train Station) was well worth it. Alternatively the hotel provides a taxi service- when I enquired they quoted me €50 one way. There is a not so pleasant smell when entering the hotel but we found this only when the main door was closed at night. The reception staff were very polite and gave us a great map and gave out good advise like not speaking to "strangers" at Termini who may offer to help you(only speak to the Police if you require assistance). The lift is tiny but it wasn't a problem as we only ever waited a couple of minutes for it! Our room was on the 3rd floor and as requested we had a quiet room facing the courtyard as my husband is a light sleeper - room 308. We had a double room which is actually a double headboard,double sheets but 2 single mattresses! Previous reports mentioned the "tiny" shower but we found it ample and very powerful which was needed after a days sightseeing! We only had breakfast the first morning as we had a lie-in the other 2! It's the usual continental style with bread rolls,croissants, ham,cheese and cereals with a coffee/tea/chocolate machine. We walked to the sights instead of taking the metro - 30 minute stroll to the Colleseum and 60 minutes to the Vatican. The best time to avoid the queues is lunchtime as most people eat then! On our last day from the Vatican we hopped on the open top bus which took us all over the city and allows you to stop off at 10 different points. The tour lasts 2 hours non stop but your ticket is valid for 24 hours, €13, was well worth it. We visited the Irish bar across the road and they had a grill menu,pizza menu and snack menu. There seemed to be many locals popping in for a quick espresso when we were there. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone as the location and service was excellent and we would love to return to Rome and the Miami soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Location and Room”
Reviews.Author: trritch
Reviews.Content: Trip started off by being picked up by a not overly friendly Hotel Driver who apparently was on a mission to get to the hotel as fast as possible at any cost. Lucky we are alive. Initial impression of the exterior was not good as well, we had to duck to enter through the door. The hotel sits amongst office spaces on the 4th floor of the building, though the Hotel Front office is on the first floor. Elevators are tight as mentioned previously, but not a big deal. Breakfast is in a tight room, typical European continental breakfast. Room was decent with a nice bathroom, safe, minibar and hairdryer. Not much to view from the rooms but convenient to most sites. Nice Irish Pub across the street. Decent stay for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: bibapoth
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers good value 3* accomodation. We stayed here in July 2006 on the 5th floor of the hotel - the rooms were reasonably spaacious and spotlessly clean. The only drawback was that our rooms were facing main road (VIa Nazionale) and we were woken up through the night with trafffic noise. The other drawback would be the size of the baths - they are a bit of a squeeze to stand in when taking a shower. But despite all this we would definately stay here in the future. The hotel is in a great location. It is about 10 minute walk from Termini station, 10-20 minute from collosuem and trevi fountain , maybe 20-30 minute walk from Vatican / spanish steps. The staff spoke good english and were very helpfull - especially Mario. We stayed here 5 nights when we first arrived in Rome - we then went onto other parts of Italy but returned to this hotel for our final night - we arrived at hotel Miami in the morning but our room was not going to be ready until the afternoon - but Mario checked us into another room which gave us the chance to freshen up for the rest of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal For Sightseers”
Reviews.Author: AdamJohns
Reviews.Content: Hotel Miami is located near to the central train station where the buses from the airport drop you and you need only find the Piazza Republica from the train station (easy) and then follow the street to get there. In the evenings you have to get buzzed in by the guy on the desk but that was always very rapid if the door hadnt been accidentally left open anyway. There was quite a funny smell from the drains in the doorway for our whole stay but ONLY in the doorway. The floors are shared with offices which gives it a very effortless and low key feel. Checking in was quick too (possibly because the night reception manager at the tiny desk was watching the World Cup, but that just made things quicker for us). The lift was the smallest I have ever seen (4 people at the most with rucksacks) but there was never a queue for it and it ran at a fairly average speed once you were in and turned up within a few seconds of pressing the button. There are piles of the most brilliant streetmaps on the opposite side of the checking in room from the desk that show you every last street and all the principle sights in the city in fantastic detail. Picking one of those up will improve your stay dramatically if you are planning to walk everywhere, especially if you plan on dragging kids around with you to make things quick and painless. The hotel is wonderfully central for all the main sights and there are several restaurants right outside as well as a pharmacy and a fairly authentic Irish bar. The best local restaurant we found was the oddly named "New Mary Meeting" where the pizzas were giant and gorgeous. The room was excellent as a place to sleep and keep your stuff. The TV has only 1 english language channel (CNN) but that did not particularly matter. The bathroom was well stocked with toilletries. The air conditioning really did the trick as well. Checking out was fast too and the day desk man helped us find a bus back to the airport rapidly and spoke good English. A great city made even better by a very satisfactory hotel. A TIP FOR ROME: Take lots of bottled water and cans of fizzy drink with you and refrigerate them in your mini-bar as you can expect to pay through the nose for them in cafes, restaurants and at the Gelati wagons. Failing that the small stores on sidestreets and the Butcher vans in the small markets do them at quite typical British prices. These places can be quite difficult to find though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Holiday-ireland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Hotel Miami in Rome last week ( August 2006 ) . The Hotel is absolutely excellent - room was air conditioned, we had a balcony, a safe, a mini bar in room, tv, private bathroom - it was absolutely great and I would certainly recomment this Hotel to any traveller to Rome. The staff were absolutely great especially the Reception Staff - hotel is very safe - lots of security and the breakfast was great. One of the best things was to take advantage of the Taxi trip from the Airport directly to the Hotel for € 50.00 it was a great start to the holiday and a great service by the Hotel. If you are going to Rome, book the Hotel Miami - it is only a few minutes walking distance from all the major Tourist attractions, there is a metro 2 minutes away, an Irish Pub across the road and an Internet Cafe 2 minutes away also - what more do you need. Loved every minute of the stay here. Thank you Hotel Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Nae78
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hotel Miami for 7 nights in the July 2006. We were 4 persons and we booked two double rooms. The rooms are very very clean and they are equipped with air conditioned, private bathroom, telephone, satellite television, hairdryer,minibar and safe deposit box. The breakfast was very good, but it was the same every day. The hotel is very close to Termini station and can be reached with a 10 minutes walk. You can walk to all the Rome's attraction, even to Vatican (it takes 1h15min). The shopping areas are very close and there is a supermarket at 100m from the hotel. We will stay again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe, great location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: TexanOnVacation
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel after reading about it on Trip Advisor and it lived up to the reviews. You have to leave your key with the front desk every time you leave the hotel which can be a pain but at least the key doesn't get lost. The doors to the floor are locked at night so we felt safe since we had teenagers staying in their own room. The elevator is tiny but generally there wasn't much wait for it, we often walked but were staying on the 5th floor so that got tiring after walking all day. The rooms were small but that was expected. They were very clean and we had no trouble with noise from other rooms or from the street (as long as the windows were closed). There is a decent sized safe in the room, we were able to put our laptop computer and several other small items in it. The a/c was helpful although the weather was awesome while we were there. The shower is very small, if you drop something you will pick it up later after you get out but the hot water worked really well. The continental breakfast is just that so don't expect big breakfast but if you like pastries, cereal, and coffee for breakfast theirs is as good as any. Every thing is in walking distance --some a long walk but the bus stop is right outside the hotel. Just be careful on the buses as apparently they are a pick pocketers favorite location. An older couple that was staying in the hotel got their money stolen on the bus. We always wore money belts and kept our group close together and stood away from strangers as much as is possible on the crowded bus. The front desk staff is friendly and helpful and speak English very well. We encountered 4 different people working the desk and all were helpful. We did get a dinner recommendation from one to go to a restaurant called Flavio that turned out not so good. It was a fair walk from the hotel and extremely expensive. The food was pretty good for Rome but they bring you stuff you didn't ask for and then when you get the bill it was outrageous so if they recommend that to you, be warned. The pizza place around the corner and across the street is ok, not too expensive and decent tasting for a quick bite. In general we were very disappointed with the Italian food in Rome. The only good Italian food place we ate at in Rome was taking a right out of the hotel, cross Via Nazionale at the corner and keep walking one block then turn right. I can't remember the name but the family was so nice and the food was really good and prices good too. If we ever go back to Rome we'd probably choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect position”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Superbly positioned, just yards from the bus stop which connects you to almost all the sites and just a couple of minutes walk to the underground, and super quick link to the Vatican and the Colliseum. Irish bar across the road and a couple of decent cafes just yards away. Hotel reception extremely helpful. Rooms spotlessly clean and room service excellent. Breakfast room a little cramped, but good continental breakfast to set you up for the day. Air conditioning was a Godsend, we visited in the middle of a heatwave and could not have slept without it. Beds firm but extremely comfortable and a free safe in the room to keep your euros and valuables. Found some great places to eat (set meals about 12 euros) just off the main square at Navona. Catch the 64 bus across the road from the hotel and you are there in 10 minutes. All in all a superb stay in Rome and will return to the hotel on our next visit

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: Bcul
Reviews.Content: truly is a great location near termini and city centre. although rooms are not large they are luxurious and air con is great.really recommend here for value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Super location”
Reviews.Author: mickey.co
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a five day stay at the Hotel Miami and considered the hotel to provide excellent value for the price we paid. The location was super and we were able to visit all the sites on foot - even the Vatican. The room was a reasonable size for two, clean, tidy and nicely furnished. The bathroom was spotless and the shower cubicle large enough for my use (I weigh about 14 stone). The lift is very small but we never waited more than about 30 secs for it to arrive and only once in five days did it fail to arrive empty. Continental breakfast was fine and there were spare tables every morning. The air conditioning was very effective and although the bed was very hard we slept perfectly OK - perhaps this was due to all the walking we had done! If travelling from the UK to Ciampino airport get return tickets from the Terravision coach desk in arrivals at 13.50 euros each. - the hotel is an easy 10 minute stroll from the coach terminus. We enjoyed a wonderful break in Rome and would not hesitate to use this hotel if ever we reurn.

Reviews.Title: “excellant central hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel after reading reviews on trip advisor so glad we did as it was just what we wanted. we walked from termini station which took about 10 minutes and arrived at miami at 1pm check in was quick but our room wasnt ready until 1.45 so we left our case and walked down via nazionale could not believe how central this hotel is for main sights. our room was immaculate lovely bathroom on floor 4 and overlooked via nazionale. bed was hard but got used to it safe in room air conditioning and fridge/mini bar. breakfast was fine we were always in early so didnt have a problem waiting for a table. we walked everywhere we wanted to go including the vatican. eating out in the evenings wasnt good, first night i had finished my meal 25 minutes before my husband was served his. next night was only slightly better with a lasagne that had no sauce in the layers but 3rd night we found a great chinese restaurant in the next street to the hotel food was lush. we loved rome and would use the hotel miami again and have reccomended it to friends

Reviews.Title: “A great stay at Hotel Miami”
Reviews.Author: Trekster
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 wonderful nights at Hotel Miami. It is in a great location, easy walk to the coloseum, forum, and Termini. We even walked across town to the Vatican without getting too worn out. The hotel was very clean and the staff, especially Mario, was very helpful. They also provided a good breakfast every morning, but I would recommend getting to breakfast early as the tables fill up very quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early May 2006 and found it had everything we needed. The location was fantastic - virtually in the middle of the Via Nazionale. Close to the Bus / Train Terminal and close to the Victoriana and the Collosseum. We were on the fourth floor in an end room so our room was slightly bigger than the others. Rooms were very, very clean, bathroom was spotless - this was the same for the rest of our party - had 3 rooms in total. Furnishings were adequate, bed was a good size. Breakfast was ok - enough choice - cereals, pastries, breads, ham, cheese, tea, coffee, orange juice, etc, etc - but the breakfast room was quite small so we had to queue for a table. No big deal really. What about the negatives? Well, there were a few. Road outside is very busy. Double glazing in the room is very effective but doesn't cut out all the noise. If you like a late afternoon snooze then this is a little annoying but I don't remember it keeping me awake at night. Our air-con unit was very noisey - would make an annoying tapping noise after being on for a while. This was particularly annoying during the night but no big deal. The worst thing was that the bed in our room was very, very hard. Now if you like a hard bed then that's fine, I don't so I woke up a few times in the night because of it. The rest of our party had hard beds to but not as bad as ours. The reception staff were extremely friendly, the building is very secure - shared with some offices and you have to buzz to get in and out at night but the reception desk is manned 24 hours a day. All in all a fabulous hotel for the money and one I heartily recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A Location Gem”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend (4 days) at the Miami Hotel, Rome. The hotel is in a prime location for access to all the sites in Rome in particular being a 15 min walk from the Colosseum and on the way you can see the Tomb of the unknown soldier, and the Forum. There is also a metro stop (Republica) at the top of the street which for €4 a day gives you unlimited use - we used this to get to the Vatican and also the Spanish Steps for a third time- when my feet wouldnt go any further!! The hotel itself was extremely well kept - our room was small but clean at all times and although we had a room overlooking the street it was the fourth floor so the noise didnt bother us . There is so much to see in Rome that little time is spent in the hotel anyway and therefore location is key. We also found the staff very friendly and helpful in particular Mario who pointed us in the right direction on numerous occasions. The breakfast was small but ample. We would certainly recommend this hotel for location alone and will stay again on our next stay in Rome. Rome itself is breathtaking - there is alot of walking, steps and queing!!!!!!!!! We would recommend that you take a tour of the Vatican Museums as although we thought we would do it ourselves it is huge and confusing - we took a tour with the Pegasus tour and the guide was excellant - taking us to the main attractions and telling very informative pieces of information and stories about the paintings and painters as we went along. We went to the museum in the morning and if we had not taken the tour the que would have been 3 hours - so money well spent!! Unfortunately St Peters was closed for the swearing in of the Swiss Guard and closings like this we were told happen now and again - so be sure to go early in your trip so you can go back as we did! It is an unforgetable city and we havent even touched on the food and wine - we found it was good value and did not fall foul of any expensive restaurants - although coke is €3.50 in most places and should be avoided!! I threw lots of coins in the Trevi Fountain and cannot wait to return!!! Hope the above helps - Ciao!!!

Reviews.Title: “Previous reviews were fair and accurate”
Reviews.Author: emma111111
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of April 2006. Good points: very clean, I'm particularly meticulous when it comes to noticing when cleaning has just been scooted over - and I could not find fault. the bathroom was as good as new. The location was very good and there were buses right outside to take you anywhere in rome, mostly direct. Take the 64 bus straight to the Vatican city. Remember to buy a 4 euro bus ticket daily which will allow you to travel anywhere. Average: breakfast, the detail said full breakfast but what we actually got was the typical continental breakfast. it was fine but average. we had a room overlooking the main road and you could hear the traffic but it was fine - if you go to a city like rome, you can't expect the tranquility of the countryside. One thing we did notice was the bed rumbled - don't laugh - it was actually the whole building when heavy buses went by - not sure how strong the foundations are but as it's terraced to the other buildings, it didn't bother us and was only noticed when you tuned into it. Summary: I would recommend this hotel for anybody wanting a city break with good value for money (we paid £300 for 3 nights) but if I came again, I would try another hotel so I could stay in another part of the city - just to try somewhere different. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: griffinjohnk
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, friendly staff, great breakfast, very clean room, great location. No faults what so ever.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: nmd4
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to most attractions, lovely hotel rooms, exceptionally clean, nice breakfast and excellent staff. Would highly recommend and will definitely be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Easter at Hotel Miami”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Miami in April of 2000 during Easter with my family of 5. If you are looking for a hotel with "GREAT" location - this is it. you can walk to the Trevi Fountain, catch a quick bus ride outside the hotel to any of Rome's main attractions. Walk to many cafe's, and restaurants nearby. Great Irish pub right across the street, and great cafe on next street corner for excellent panini sandwiches or cappucino. Nice stores across the street for leather boots and shoes. Bathrooms are modern, rooms are clean and neat. We stayed in 2 rooms in the back and didn't hear any noise from the street. Staff is very helpful and nice. You can even walk to the train station from here. Have recommended it to many people and they said it was a perfect place with great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: brian4951
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Miami for a few days in early March. We were impressed with the hotel (My wife is very fussy!). The staff were extremely helpful and pleasant.Rooms were very clean and well presented and not "dog-eared" like some hotels. It's a bit strange having to ring the bell to get in after 8pm but you're there to see Rome not worry too much about the hotel. It is within easy walking distance of all the major sites although the Vatican is a bit of a walk.TI, pick up a bus from the Termini to Piazza San Pietro the express is best, it takes you straight there with no stopping. Get a daily ticket from the news stand opposite the buses (4 euros) with this you can travel on ALL public transport all day until midnight. Cheaper than the 110 City tour bus.Also get the Leonardo Express from the Airport (9euros 50 single). The hotel is only about 8-10 minutes away. When you get off the train go to the right hand platform and follow the Exit/Metro signs, it will bring you out at the front of the Terminus, walk ahead through the bus station for about 200yards, turn left at the Piazza Repubblica and the hotal is about 400yds on the right. We will certainly go back to this hotel! One note, if the previous reviewer had problems with the hotel, then perhaps they should have followed the hotel rules and not used a steamer!

Reviews.Title: “Ripped OFF by hotel”
Reviews.Author: msbtx
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a very unpleasant experience at the Hotel Miami in Rome in September 2005. We were charged 195 euros for the comforter in our room b/c they accused us of ruining it with our steamer and told us that it was one of a kind and very expensive. Well it was not so special b/c there were 2 identical blankets in the closet. We felt like we were ripped off and taken advantage of b/c we were "stupid American tourist." The staff of extremely rude and insulting. As you can see I do not have a high regard for this hotel and I am highly recommend you avoid it all cost.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place. Strange lobby.”
Reviews.Author: corevel
Reviews.Content: It is really a nice hotel in a great location for sights and only a few blocks to the central train station. For travelers who are not used to Rome's small hotel market, be prepared to show up at a closed front door that you have to be buzzed into. A lobby that is a small office on the ground floor of an old office-type building, and your room starting on the 5th floor of this office building. If you can handle what I just said, it is a very nice place. Worth the stay, particularly for the price. Nice job Hotel Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Very good - had a nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: Moonstomper
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is really alright. If you don't expect the Ritz you will have a pleasant stay. On initial impressions it doesn't look like a hotel from the outside. In fact the hotel occupies a few floors of what would seem to be an office block. The entrance is a small door (not much bigger than a caflap) within a massive door. The reception is small but the staff are friendly and helpful. It is a bit odd. The rooms are big,clean and tidy - even the mini-bar is reasonably priced. Don't expect a great view out of the window. My girlfriend didn't like the fact that the floors in the room were marble effect and not carpet. Just remember to take a pair of slippers.... The bed is the firmest bed I have ever slept on. The only gripe I would have is that the breakfast area can get a bit cramped. We were lucky to get a table. On the plus side it is in an excellent location - walking distance from most of the attractions and the main train station (termini). Important note!! If you go from the airport to the Termini train/bus station - don't take a taxi to the hotel. Roman taxi drivers are robdogs! We were charged 20 euros for a 7 euro journey from Termini to Hotel Miami. Buy a map and walk if your bags are not too heavy. It really is only 8 minutes. If you must take a taxi - agree the price first and follow his progress with a map!! They will rip you off! They have no shame! This experience took the edge off what was otherwise a great weekend in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Miami”
Reviews.Author: JFE
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at Hotel Miami and were very pleased with the accommodations and service. The rooms are located on the 4th and 5th floors of a building with the reception room on the first floor. The hotel is located on a main street with many stores available for shopping, cafes, even a grocery store within a block or two. Bus stops are right in front of the building making it accessible to reach city attractions. Metro and the main train station are within walking distance which made it ideal for day trips. The rooms we occupied on the 5th floor (2 doubles and a single)seemed recently updated and tastefully decorated. Though fronting a main street the rooms were fairly insulated from street noise. The rooms/bathrooms were a bit small but exceptionally clean. Breakfast was included and served daily in two rooms on the 5th floor. The front desk staff we encountered were all pleasant and helpful. I would definitely stay again and strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Miami was in a great location. Close to the Termini Train Station as well as being a nice central location to all of the sights. We actually walked everywhere, even Vatican City (which was a bit of a long walk). The staff was friendly and helpful, especially Mario. The rooms were very nice, they looked like they had been recently remodeled. Hotel Miami is on Via Nazionale which is a busy street so there was alot of noise outside our window throughout the night, we sleep well through noise so it wasn't a problem for us. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A surprisingly nice hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: ColmDAthlone
Reviews.Content: By Roman standards this is a very nice hotel. It provides a good balance of price versus location and quality. The staff were very nice and polite (unlike the rest of Rome). The room was small but clean and well organized. The building was a little depressing but quite acceptable. The breakfast room was uncomfortably small when busy. I would happily recommend it to anyone spending a few days in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lost my purse in their restaurant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Staff spoke good english and very helpful. Rooms were small but very nice and clean. Restaurant consisted of two small rooms and breakfast was ample. What would have been an enjoyable stay was cut short when somebody took off with my purse in their restaurant while having breakfast. Since the hotel shares its entrance w/ a bank, there was no surveillance camera in the restaurant and the waitresses didn't ask any guest for the room number. Only after I reported the incident to the polizia that they took measures in the restaurant. They said they will have their insurance reimburse for my loss since the theft happened in their vicinity. Three months later, no action has been done. Will not stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Price”
Reviews.Author: Sun_Lakes_Jim
Reviews.Content: Our experience pretty much matched the other reviews - a little small by US standards, but clean and well located. Check out the Zeus Resturant a few doors down. We got an excellent price of $184 (not Euros) a night for a room for two by booking through British Air at their "Holidays" site. They charge your credit card and send you vouchers. I initially thought that you could only use this web site if you were traveling on British Air, (as we were), but some friends traveling on other airlines and meeting us in Rome were able to use it also. The site appears to have several hotels at pretty good prices and you can lock in your cost in $$.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Price”
Reviews.Author: lilkyla
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Miami during our trip in early March. The hotel was the nicest place we stayed in while in Italy. It was very clean and comfortable. The staff was very nice and helpful. We paid €80 a night but it was the low season. We stayed in Pensions the rest of the time and the Miami was a nice quiet change. It is not a five star hotel, more comparable to a Comfort Inn. If you are looking for a cheap, clean comfortable room, I suggest the Miami.

Reviews.Title: “bRILLIANT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: emangee
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a four day break in Rome with my daughter and would recommend the Miami - mostly for its central location. The Via Nazionale is handy for the station and all the main sites. It's also on the bus route for the 40 and 64 buses that will take you to the Vatican. Our room was at the front so we could get the feel of the city, but not the noise as it's double glazed, and the air-con really worked. The room was very clean and comfortable, and the bathroom was fine. The shower was brilliant. My only moan would be the breakfast beverages - poor coffee and awful fruit juice. The food was fine though. Also Mario was charming - just as we expected! Loved Rome - will def go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my parents in April 05 when we were visiting my sister. We got a triple room which had a queen bed and a pull out bed, that could be described as a cot. The pullout bed wasn't terrible and I slept well enough on it. The room was pretty small, because the pull out bed took up much of the floor space. The furniture and decor looked fairly new and nice. Bathroom was nice, but the shower was small. It was a 5-10 minute walk to the Termini train station and about a 20-30 minute walk to spots like the Forum, Colesium and Spanish Steps. Take a bus, taxi or the subway if you want to go to the Vatican (unless you like to walk) The only real negative about the hotel is the entrance as described in other reviews. Kinda puts an ugly face on a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: rozsalind
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a 3 night stay at the hotel miami and would like to say what a super time we had there. on first appearance this is a very old building and some of the main areas and stairwells could do with being updated but the room we were given (quad room) at the front of the hotel was clean and bright and looked as if it had been recently updated, despite being at the front on a very busy and noisy main street we had no problem with any noise due to the window shutters and very good double glazing, the room was very clean and cleaned to a very good standard throughout our stay with fresh linen every day and clean towells, if i had to make a complaint about anything it would be the size of the shower, (tiny) not a complaint more of an observation, as we all managed and we are a tall family!! the staff at the miami we all very helpfull especially mario and pedro, whom both spoke very good english and were always pleasant and helpfull we had pre booked 2 tours with angeltours after reading about the large queues for the main attractions, but after not being able to actually find the guides!!! we did it all on our own, we never waited longer than 15 minutes to see anything, i think we were just very lucky as when came out of the vatican and sisteen chapel the queues were stretching around the block!!. all in all we had a fantastic stay, even the children enjoyed themselves (age 13 & 8) and ours are hard to please. we would thorughly recomend the miami for your stay, dont expect luxury, but if you want a clean comfortable stay, excellent location for all attractions, buses and train station (termini), this is your hotel

Reviews.Title: “One of my all time Favorite hotels!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect! It is a renovate old building. It is very clean, bright and the decor is lovely, with high ceilings and polished stone floors. We found the staff to be very politeful and most helpfull. The front desk attendants spoke English very well. The breakfast was an excellent typical European breakfast, kept well stocked throughout breakfast. The location is good for tourists as it is along a bus route and a 10 minute walk to the Termini station. The roomm was a good size, the three of us had plenty of room and the bathroom was the same size as most chain hotels. For business, we had to spend our first nights at a Sheraton. I wish that we could have spent our entire time at the Miami, our stay there was that good. It is a great Hotel for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel / Location”
Reviews.Author: DerekWendyCheshire
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay in Rome, hotel Miami on Via Nationale, about 15 minutes walk from the train station, and about the same time to the Trevi Fountain and the Forum area. A really nice Hotel good location, the staff were very helpful and the place was very clean and tidy. If you do go ask for a room to the rear (as we did) of the Hotel because the frontage is on a busy road. We shall certainly be going back to Rome and would not hesitate to stay at the Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy”
Reviews.Author: MarkMFC
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Miami for 4 nights from the 26th May this year mainly based on reports on here. The hotel is comfortable for a short stay and is clean. The bathroom is fairly small and the shower is very compact, could be tight for anyone over 14 stone!!!! This was also very clean. Breakfast was OK, typical continental with pastries etc. The big thing about this hotel is it's location, all the main sights to see are within easy walking distance. Mario proved to be very helpful as were the rest of the staff on duty when he wasn't there. Would recommend this as a good hotel to stay in when in Rome and on a medium budget.

Reviews.Title: “Just so-so”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We also selected this hotel based on positive reviews. I was expecting a lot based on what we researched but came away disappointed. The room was fairly clean but something about the place seemed run down. The room itself was tiny but looked like it was redone within the past few years. Since the hotel shares a lobby and hallways with other offices, perhaps I was somewhat put off by the run-down common areas and elevator. One positive of the hotel is the location. The location was such a big plus that it makes it a tough call, but overall I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Miami OK, but not great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading pretty good reviews on Trip Advisor, we were looking forward to staying there, but we were somewhat disappointed with the hotel especially considering the 180 Euro price for the 4-person accommodation. The room was fine, but very small, and with 2 more or less cots squeezed into one room, a queen sized bed taking up all but a very small area in the second room. The bathroom was nicely tiled, but the shower (only) was very small. The hotel co-exists with offices, and the stairs, elevators and common areas before one reaches the areas containing the hotel rooms were old, dirty and not well maintained. The hotel area itself is pleasant enough. It bothered us that there was really no large, pleasant, lobby to hang out in to make up for the small room. In addition, it really bugged my wife that instead of serving the usual wonderful Italian coffee for breakfast, what was offered was instant coffee from a machine (strange considering the hotel’s 3-star status). You could ask for fresh coffee, but at times the staff seemed off-put by such a request. About the best thing going for the hotel is the location, pretty convenient to a lot of Rome sights, within walking distance of most of them, and also convenient to the Termini train station.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed (English couple in 20's) for 4 nights at Hotel Miami in April 05, and it was great. The hotel had a great location (10/15 mins walk from some of the main sites). We had no trouble finding it walking from the Termini train station (at 1am). The staff were really friendly and the food (which has been complained about) was fine. There was a wide range of things eg cereal, pastries, bread, meat, cheese, yogurts, fruit juice, tea, coffee, hot choc etc. There is plenty and you can help yourself so it wil last you until lunch time. The rooms were very clean, and we were situated on the 5th floor next to the main road, which is busy but with our window closed you could hardly hear anything. There is also air conditioning in the room and a mini bar. The tv has sky and there are about 3 or 4 channels which are in english. I agree the rooms are small but to be honest - why do you need lots of space? If you are going to rome you should be out seeing the sites. Its not that bad - im sure you could swing a small cat! Once having checked out of the room you can keep your luggage in the reception area until you have to leave, which is really helpful. As for Rome itself i suggest the best way is for you to discover it yourself but the hotel provides a small map (which is great - better than the maps which open out to be bigger then you) which they mark the hotel on so you can find your way about. I would recommend the open top bus tours, which you can get from the Termini train station ( there is a stand outside where the buses are). Well worth while and for those who dont fancy the hour walk to the Vatican the bus drops off at each site then you can catch the next one. And finally - if you are travelling with Ryan Air and choose to get the Terravision coach (again good idea) you can buy tickets as soon as you arrive at Ciampino and where they drop you off at the Termini - there is a hotel opposite which has a timetable on the reception desk inside for your return coach. I hope this is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly good, clean”
Reviews.Author: SA_Tourist
Reviews.Content: The Miami was a fair hotel, and i loved the fact that it was CLEAN! but the rave reviews about Mario are definitely inflated. The hotel info brochure advertised that an extention to the 12.00pm check-out was possible, but when we queried with Mario, he did not even bother to check, he simply shook his head and said it was not possible. The lift is small, but not as small as the bathroom!! Definitely not meant for a large person, and you tend to feel pretty claustrophobic. But the breakfast was good, its within easy walking distance to the Termini, and for a short stay, it's not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Good for our family”
Reviews.Author: wavemom
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed in a "suite" in Hotel Miami in March. The suite was actually two adjacent rooms that were connected by a hallway with a door that could be closed and locked so that the doors to the rooms could be left open. This was not as convenient as true adjoining rooms as the doors would close and lock if not propped open and the keys had to be left in the light switch to keep the lights working. However, it worked well for our family as our kids are a little older -- 7 and 12. The rooms were large and clean and the bathrooms were nice. Street noise was bothersome even five floors up but not unbearable. The location of the hotel was wonderful -- near the train station but in an area that felt very safe. Lots of restaurants, shopping, and most Roman sights within easy walking distance. The staff was friendly and helpful and the front desk staff spoke English very well. I would recommend this spot to anyone looking for a mid-level hotel.

Reviews.Title: “rome in march”
Reviews.Author: glgmanchester_UK
Reviews.Content: We just got back for Rome and stayed 7 nights in the Hotel Miami.. we had a corner room and it was great, not small at all.. although we only had 1 pillow each and the bed was hard.. haha! Mario was very helpful and the rooms were cleaned each day to an excellent standard. HOWEVER the Vatican Museums trip is NOT worth the price -be careful.... 46 Euros each, and they take in you in the morning where the queues (lines) are so long (1 hour we waited) NO WHERE was this mentioned in the leaflet..the tour guide was no good and we actually chose to get off at st peters square, this wasnt part of the tour.. You can do this tour yourself for half the price - the hotel isnt that far away - in fact the hotel is not far away from most 'tourist places' (on foot) On the plus we did the Romans Forums tour which was excellent, a lot cheaper with a much much better tour guide. On the whole the hotel is just what you want and opposite an Irish bar.. say no more...

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: LTT
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights last weekend. The key feature of this hotel is it's location. You can access all of the sites on foot. The set up is strange, as the hotel occupies several floors in one large building, with other businesss in the building. I don't know how helpful the highly acclaimed Mario is as none of the staff introduced themselves or had name badges etc. Hotel perfectly adequate and clean, but as mentioned in previous reviews, who goes to Rome to sit in a hotel room?! We love Rome, it's a fantastic place with so much history it overwhelms you!! There is an open top bus now. You purchase the ticket at Termini and can hop on hop off all day, you do get an ear phone that you plug in (new & Clean!), and learn some interesting facts as the bus travels around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: ktscott01
Reviews.Content: Don't take 3 of 5 as a bad rating. It was just an average hotel that didn't have anything that really made it above average. We took the Leonardo Express train from the airport to the train station. Then walked to the hotel from the station. It was a short walk that only took 10 minutes. We went to check-in early on a Monday morning when we arrived in Rome and Mario was at the front desk. He was very nice and spoke good English. He told us the rooms were not ready so we just dropped off our luggage and had a go at Rome. Check-in was easy. Mario's English was good so he made it easy. We also asked questions and he had all the answers. He was very nice and helpful. The one thing I didn't like was we left our bags in the reception office (along with many other bags) because we were there so early before our room was ready, but the bags weren't tagged with our room # or anything. They just sat there waiting for us to come back and pick them up. Now as far as I know there was someone at the desk the whole time but I just felt uneasy thinking someone could just grab out bags with theirs and walk out if the person at the desk didn't remember who's bags they were. As for the rooms they are very small with tight quarters but manageable. There was a small elevator so you didn't have to carry your bags up the stairs. -Beds were the European firm uncomfortable beds. -The closet was a nice size with a few drawers. All the hangers were ones that must have come from clothing stores. -TV was 13" and got BBC World news in English. Plus Sky Sports (I think). -Fridge with a mini bar and enough room to buy drinks from the supermarket right down the street. -Bathroom had the smallest shower I have ever seen. You really had to open the door if you dropped the soap. We never had any problems with hot water. The blow dryer was weak according to my wife. Everything else worked just fine. -Heat worked well in the room at night but seems cold during the day when we were in there. We did get some noise from the street but it never bothered me that much. You are right in Via Nazionale which is a nice drag with a lot of shops and places to eat. Plus there is a taxi stand in the plaza right down the street. We walked to everything except the Vatican. The breakfast was pretty basic. Rolls, spreads, fruit, yogurt, cereal, meats (cold cuts), cheeses, juices and coffee. I did get sick from the meat but I didn't hold that against them. Another point to know Hotel Miami asks that you drop off you big cumbersome room key every time you leave the hotel. This way you don't lose it. This was sort of annoying because the front door is locked at 8 so you need to ring the office to get buzzed in.
