There were a few occasions that there was no one there to answer the door so we had to wait 15-20 minutes to get in. That was really annoying. Overall we were happy with the Hotel Miami. They had a great rate (80 euros in Feb 05) for our stay and most of the reviews were good overall. If I was going to Rome again I can't say I would definitely stay here again without looking to see what else is out there but I would not have a problem if I had to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience at Hotel Miami”
Reviews.Author: biogal
Reviews.Content: I spent five nights at the Hotel Miami in September. The hotel is situated only a few blocks from the subway station (very convenient) and within walking distance of the Coliseum. The English-speaking staff was very friendly and helpful and the hotel itself was very clean and has an abundance of character. The room was clean as well, but very tiny (I had spent a week on Isola d'Elba at the Hermitage hotel the week before and that room felt like a suite in comparison). There was barely enough space to fit two suitcases in the room. The beds were very hard (as is normal in Europe) and the toilet was slow to flush... but the breakfast was great, the balcony was wonderful (not a great view, but fun to open the door up and step outside) and the location was worth the small inconveniences. A great place to stay if you don't plan on spending too much time indoors (and why on earth would you want to with so much to see in Rome!).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: IanE15
Reviews.Content: Very clean and a short walk from the termini station... quirky layout at hotel as rooms in various areas of multi occupied building. Staff extremely friendly. Advise room to rear as much quieter. Other reviewers seem unhappy with breakfast but it's OK just nothing special, though coffee very average. If you don't want to walk far to eat the restaurant in the next side street is good. Also try the 'opera aria' recitals in the church on the other side of Via Nazionale... just great.

Reviews.Title: “There is better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the reviews but I was disappointed. The rooms were tiny but it is centrally located. When we were checking out we had a problem with our bill and I was made to feel like I was completely in the wrong and the once freindly reception person turned quite nasty with me. I would not recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel, fantastic value for money!”
Reviews.Author: philipo49
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in the Hotel Miami from the 23rd - 26th January 2005 and couldn't find any faults with the hotel or the service we received. The entrance to the hotel is a little quirky but dont be put off by this, it will not affect your stay one bit. You walk into the hotel through two huge doors into a large marble and stone reception area that appears to be shared between the hotel and some offices with the hotel reception off to the side. The lifts and stairs are also shared with a door to the hotel rooms on every level. Once you're through these doors you enter the Hotel part of the building and immediately notice how warm and well decorated it is. The staff on the front desk (particularly Mario) were brilliant, they all spoke perfect English and will help you with anything you need to know to make your holiday easier. The room was spotlessly clean and looked like it had only just been decorated and it was cleaned to an excellent standard on a daily basis. We had a room on the front of the hotel as requeated because we like to be able to see the hustle and bustle of the city from our room. This can sometimes mean lots of noise but not at the Miami, once the double glazed window was shut you could barely hear a sound from the very busy road below. The breakfast that is served every morning is of an excellent standard with lots of variety and plenty on offer. There is yoghurt, sweet pastries, rolls, ham, cheese, cereals, orange juice and all the tea & coffee you can drink. The location of the hotel is perfect for people who like to be within walking distance of the main attractions. The Roman Forum and Colloseum are a 10 minute walk away and you can walk to all the other attractions (trevi fountain, spanish steps etc) within 25 - 30 mins And if you do visit Rome, walking is definately the best form of transport because you will stumble across so many fantastic sights. If you do stay at the Hotel Miami there is a restaurant about 200 yards up the road (on the same side as the Miami) called Zeus. We ate in there a couple of times and the food is absolutely gorgeous and not too expensive with the staff all speaking English and all set in a very relaxed atmosphere. Eat there and you wont be disappointed! All in all we had a brilliant time in Rome and part of that was down to the Miami Hotel. Rome is a very safe city where you can walk around at night with out feeling unsafe and the Italian people there are some of the friendliest we have ever come across.

Reviews.Title: “would go back again!”
Reviews.Author: bertha122
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Miami for 4 nights during mid January. As a first timer in Europe, I don't have any other experience to compare to. But I definitely have no complaints about the hotel. In fact, during the first two nights of my stay, I felt that the highlights of my trip was the hotel. As a typical California girl, I just learned the hard way that several acts are not welcome in Rome: trying out a couple samples before purchasing in a Gelato place; wasting the server's time by asking "too many" questions about the menu, or asking him to give us a few minutes; wearing flip-flops to breakfast; walking out of a store without a purchase after trying on several jackets and none of them fit (small shops only...not Burberry or Dior where there is a higher quality of customer service) Anyway...got the rate at $85 per night and extra 5% cash discount. What I look for in a hotel is simple: cleanliness (esp bathroom!), absence of insects of any kind, hot water and WATER PRESSURE, and most important of all: worthiness of the price. Hotel Miami aced in all these criteria. Breakfast was actually better that what I had expected, although it's the same food every day. The size of both the room and the bathroom was really fine with me. The sink was relatively big too (I tend to splatter water everywhere when I wash my face) The maid did an excellent job with tidying our stuff in our room (more detailed than Bellagio's in Las Vegas) Smiles don't come as often in Rome(some sort of styles?!) as in Cali so the lady in the breakfast room always brightened my day.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - we had a v. good room!”
Reviews.Author: r9kep
Reviews.Content: We have no complaints. We got a very nice, very new looking room at the back of the hotel, away from the main road traffic! Very quiet. The breakfast was okay and everything was nice and clean. The people on the front desk were very helpful indeed, plus there are loads of shops on the main road (chemist for mosquito bite treatment!!) with loads of buses running along it. The main line station is also very close. We walked to there with our suitcases to get the express train to the airport - very quick! We will return!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is immaculate and very centrally located on Via Naxionale. The staff are very very nice and helpful. The rooms are immaculate and the power shower excellent. Our room was cleaned to such a high standard every day it was a pleasure to open the door after a long day sight seeing. My favourite part though was at night. The main door which is about twenty feet high and made of iron is locked and a smaller door opens ( which is set in the main door). You feel like Alice in Wonderland stepping out into the main road...

Reviews.Title: “Loved the nice rooms and the great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What else to say, is just perfect. Clean rooms, excellent location, friendly and helpfull staff. The best choice in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel. Clean. Great staff.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Miami in mid October. As this forum attests, Mario is indeed one of its charms. He goes out of his way to make guests feel welcome. Duck! You must ring to be let in. Suddenly a smaller door amid a large door opens. Even the shortest adults will need to watch their heads as they enter. But this rather humble introduction aside, it’s a well-maintained, well-staffed, clean hotel. We ended up walking to all the sights. Nothing (except the Vatican) seemed more than 15 minutes away. Termini is five-ten minutes away. We heard a couple of guests complain about noise on the Via Nazionale side of the hotel. But it didn’t bother us. It depends on your noise tolerance level. We had two rooms on two visits. Our room on 3rd floor was larger, with a much larger bathroom. Overall...Good value (cash discount). Decent location (but a business district) between Termini and the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Helpful, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 day trip to Rome with my sister & girlfriend. Booked a cab from the airport through the hotel manager before trip & taxi was waiting on our arrival which makes it so much easier than taking the bus. Only 90 euro's between us for pickup & return. On arrival we met Mario and a more friendly, helpful manager you could not get, always ready to help - all the staff were great. On the down side the room for 3 of us was a bit cramped and dark & the beds were very hard, but would not say it spoilt our trip in anyway and in fact slept well. The breakfast room was very small for the amount of people who were staying at the hotel - and the food was not great. But for what we paid could not really complain - location was great as well. On the whole I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome. Vicky Monk - Harlow Essex

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Miami a few weeks ago after reading about it on the internet, and apart from a couple of small things it was great. Negatives first: breakfast, as others have reported is nothing to write home about (dodgy juice, no hot food, and plastic-looking ham and cheese). Also, while I understand the thinking behind the idea of having to insert your key fob in a slot inside the door if you want electricity in your room, it's a bit of a pain that you can't leave the air conditioning on while you're out. On the positive side the location couldn't be more central - we were able to walk everywhere except to the Vatican (even with elderly relatives in tow!). Also, despite what other reviewers have said, there were loads of nice restaurants within a 5-minute walk of the hotel and an added bonus was that we felt quite safe wandering about at night. The hotel staff couldn't have been more helpful, recommending and booking restaurants for us, giving directions, and providing translations. I was looking forward to meeting Mario as I'd read so much about him on this site and he didn't disappoint. I would definitely stay at the Miami again, and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, one small problem”
Reviews.Author: Illustr8or
Reviews.Content: This is a great location in Rome. Close to everything, including Termini Station. I stayed 5 years ago and was not very happy. The room was tiny, needed renovation and the bathroom had no shower...it was the shower...the whole room. After reading that it was renovated, I tried it again, and it was great. The front desk is now on the ground floor, not an upper floor. The rooms have been redone and were really nice. The front desk guy, Mario, remembered me from 5 years ago. He is very nice and helpful. Cannot be touched for the price. I have read that street noise is a problem here. That is not true. With the window open it is very noisy. Close the sturdy double pane windows and it is silent. Stay on the street side for great views of Via Nazionale. The one problem was with noise from within. When adjacent rooms flush there toilet, it is like you are in their bathroom it is so loud. Maybe it was just my room. Otherwise, definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A fine place to stay if you are not one of the over fussy Americans..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Miami Hotel is a nice place for the money and compares very well to others of equal grading. A great location with a bus stop that will take you to all the sites. A walk to Trevi fountain/Pantheon will take less than 20 minutes. The Miami Hotel is clean and breakfast is fine and for those who want more then eat out - there are hundreds of cafes etc I lost my luggage and the hotel staff were very helpful and called the airport on literally dozens of occasions - if you are unlucky enough to lose your luggage my advice would be to return to the airport and check the lost baggage rooms for yourself. Go to terminal C and there are at least 3 orphaned suitcase rooms. I would certainly stay here again - for the money and location then this is as good as it gets.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe Too Much Character?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On the positive side, location is great. The subway station is about 5 minute walk away. The train station is only 15 minutes walk away. There are two buses that the typical tourist will use right on the same street as the hotel, one takes you to the Collessum, the other the vatican. Found the facilities to be very clean and they have used upgraded materials in the rooms (marble and tile). The staff at the front counter spoke English very well and they were helpful. The front counter person Mario (who I had read about in some many reviews) was on vacation during my stay. On the negative side rooms are not just small, some (at least the one I stayed in) are configured in a very unusual fashion. We had two beds, each only 3 feet wide. The room was about 7 feet wide and 20 feet long, with a semi divider separating the two bed areas. Thus only the person whose bed was in the area with the TV could watch the TV. Speaking of which, there was no English content TV channels among the channels shown (some other hotels featured a couple). There were a host of eccentric features about this hotel room. For instance, to use the lights, you needed to place the metal attached to your key in a slot by the door. To use the airconditioner, you needed to use a remote that controlled the air conditioner, which was located 9 feet up in the wall. When you left the hotel, you were requested to leave your key at the front desk. If you returned at night, the door to the hotel was locked and you had to buz the front desk. When we went to check out at 5:15 AM, the front desk clerk was sleeping and it took us until 5:30 AM to wake him. Street hotel is located was certainly less seedy that the area around the train terminal. Most of the businesses were not geared to tourists. There were only a few restaurants and two of those were McDonalds and Burger King! Hotel had no ice. The breakfast had no hot foods and the foods they did offer were not very tasty. For instance, they had ceral that looked like rice krispies, but certainly did not taste like them! In summary, location is good, hotel is very clean but I think this hotel might have too much character for the typical American tourist.

Reviews.Title: “I'll stay at the Miami hotel again on my next visit.”
Reviews.Author: MadrileÃ±a
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel, even better staff, always helpful and cheerful. Room spacious and very clean. Hotel very well situated 5 mins walk for Colosseum and 10 mins walk from Fontana de Trevi. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Miami for 5 nights in August. It has a great location, in walking distance of all the main sights (except the vatican which is only a short tube ride away) and there are plenty of shops and restaurants nearby. The rooms were lovely, the hotel was clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The air-conditioning was very useful for the time of year. There was a great variety of food at breakfast although it could have been served until a bit later. Overall this is a great hotel and I would definately recommend staying there!
